quotes.race: Prix de Malleret (Group 2) (3yo Fillies) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: It was a tactical race, but Stephane was in the right place and Survie knows how to quicken. She is in the Arc, she will have a break and could possibly run in the Prix Vermeille first - Nicolas Clement, trainer.

quotes.race: Prix Allez France (Group 3) (4yo+ Fillies & Mares) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: On that evidence the Curragh against her own sex now comes into the reckoning, because we could look at keeping her to 2,000 metres [ten furlongs]. Aventure has grown and strengthened over the winter and while she is quite lightly made, she has muscled up through her shoulder and behind - Christophe Ferland, trainer.

quotes.race: Qatar Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe (Group 1) (3yo+ No Geldings) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Aventure has run the perfect race, she was exceptional. We had the same fight as in the Vermeille. Obviously there is some regret that we were second but it was a beautiful second in an Arc de Triomphe. When she went after the leader there was a moment when I thought she'd do it but we've once again come across a real racehorse and an exceptional four-year-old filly - Christophe Ferland, trainer.

quotes.race: Prix de Pomone (Group 2) (3yo+ Fillies & Mares) (Round Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Aventure had a proper holiday on the farm after the Diane and only came back to me in July, so I really hadn't got much work into her. From that point of view, I loved what she did and Stephane's comments were very reassuring as well, because he always felt he had the others covered and was delighted with the way she picked up - Christophe Ferland, trainer.

3:45.race_name: Marske Fabrication & Engineering Straight Mile Handicap (Marske Straight Mile Qualifier)

runners.name: Rajapour
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: Listed winner when trained in France; two moderate runs for current yard last season.
runners.spotlight: Listed winner when trained in France; looked to be on the downgrade in two starts for current yard last season; yet to race on ground faster than good; hard to fancy.

runners.name: Cadarn
runners.comment: Got off the mark on his seasonal/handicap debut over C&D four weeks ago.
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark on his seasonal/handicap debut over C&D (good to firm) four weeks ago; up just 3lb and he should have further improvement in him; hard to beat.

stable_tour.quote: I've yet to run him on turf, but his work has been pretty good this spring and I hope he's now matured and we'll see the best of him. His form slightly dipped on his last start and I hope we can get him in the winner's circle before long. 07-04-25

runners.name: Savvy Kingdom
runners.comment: Missed last year but won on AW at Newcastle 17 days ago; should run well back on turf.
runners.spotlight: Has improved this season in two runs on AW after missing last year; scored at Newcastle (1m) 17 days ago and should run well if able to translate current form to turf.

quotes.race: Quaff Box Handicap
quotes.quote: Savvy Kingdom is a very nice horse. Fair play to Mr Woods [trainer] and the team at home. He had a little setback but the owners have been very patient and it's paid off. We'll be going a mile and two [furlongs] I'd say with him next time on turf and that should suit him perfectly - Ben Sanderson, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Bowood
runners.comment: Raced too freely following a slow start back on turf at Ripon last month; best watched.
runners.spotlight: Won three in a row last summer but has lost his way a bit this year; raced too freely following slow start back on turf when last of eight at Ripon (1m, good) last month; still 12lb above last winning mark; best watched.

quotes.race: Dine & Stay At The Old Deanery Ripon Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: The race was run to suit. We thought they were going to go very quick and I said to Ellie 'whatever you do, don't panic.' She gave Bowood a perfect ride. The change of scenery has probably done the trick with him, he's a very happy horse at the moment. He's progressing and I hope he can still do a bit more. I think he'll stay a mile and a quarter in time - Ivan Furtado, trainer.

runners.name: Leadenhall
runners.comment: Won on seasonal debut at Pontefract last month; up 5lb and may struggle to follow up
runners.spotlight: Failed to win last year but returned to winning ways on his seasonal debut at Pontefract (1m, good) last month; up 5lb and may struggle to follow up.

quotes.race: Betfred Nifty 50 Handicap
quotes.quote: Leadenhall has always had a lot of talent. They've ironed out a few of his issues, the headgear was off today and it worked out nicely. Hopefully this will be a confidence booster - Hector Crouch, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's a huge horse and another one we bought at the Horses In Training Sale. We're very happy with him at home and he has some decent form. We think a mile is his trip, but he might get a bit further; we won't know until we run him. 23-04-24

runners.name: Tropez Power
runners.comment: 1-24 on turf and better on AW (4 wins); hasn't made the frame in five starts this year.
runners.spotlight: 1-24 on turf and better on AW (four wins); hasn't made the frame in five starts this year; first-time blinkers are applied but hard to fancy.

stable_tour.quote: He's had three runs on the all-weather this season, so he's qualified for the mile handicap on finals day, and he'll have a crack at that before switching back to turf. He's rated 6lb lower on grass and we think he can win off that mark but quick ground may be quite important to him - he didn't get loads of that last year. 20-03-24

4:15.race_name: Watch Racing TV In Stunning HD Handicap (Div I)
4:15.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 8.7) (Watered)
4:15.stalls: Straight course - Stands' side; Round course - Inside

runners.name: One More Dream
runners.comment: Most of his winning has been done on AW (nine wins) but has won twice on turf recently
runners.spotlight: Most of his winning has been done on AW (nine wins), but has been in sparkling form on turf recently with wins at Pontefract (5f, good) last month and at Doncaster (6f, good to firm) 16 days ago; second at Catterick (6f, good to firm) last Monday; looks sure to run well.

stable_tour.quote: He's a decent all-weather horse and has won at Newcastle and Southwell this month and been second twice. He may switch back to turf but dry ground is quite important to him. When he's right he tries very hard and he's the sort who's important to the yard because he can win two or three a year and if every horse did that you'd have an awful lot of winners. He's entered at Newcastle on Friday. 20-03-24

runners.name: Muscika
runners.comment: Prolific winner but hasn't won on turf since August 2023; on career-low mark
runners.spotlight: Prolific winner but hasn't won on turf since August 2023; hasn't been beaten far on last two starts and has dropped to his lowest mark, so cannot be discounted.

quotes.race: Find More Big Deals At BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: Muscika is a lovely old boy. The last day at Epsom went really well and today went the same, he jumped out and has a nice gate speed, which is good from a low draw here. We went a nice enough gallop but I didn't have to use too much petrol and he travelled into it well. He's really found his form again - Cieren Fallon, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Betfred Nifty 50 Handicap (Jockey Club Grassroots Sprint Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Muscika jumped well and I got a very, very soft lead, surprisingly. We dawdled in front and then kicked and just nicked the race. He's an old boy, he's in good form and he was unlucky to get touched off at Wolverhampton the last day. He's handled the track very well. He's well balanced and he travels, which is what you need. He was true and honest to the line and I couldn't pull him up towards the end. Jockeys dream for rides like that where you jump out, bowl along and nothing catches you. It was like a piece of work and we never saw another rival - Cieren Fallon, jockey.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Extended Dash Handicap
quotes.quote: We've always thought there was a good race in Muscika and he's proved it today. We might look at going back for the Great St Wilfrid after he finished fourth in it last year - Richard Walker, racing manager for owners Gallop Racing.

quotes.race: JW 4x4 Northallerton Handicap
quotes.quote: Muscika was dropped in last time and went a bit sour with it, so the boss said ride him handy. He travelled through the race great and quickened up before idling a bit when in front. He's a fine horse and hopefully there's more to come - Cam Hardie, jockey

quotes.race: Visit The Start Today Maiden Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: Muscika is a nice big horse, but he is still a bit raw and green. He ran on well in the closing stages when the penny dropped. He may stay further but he could get quicker with racing - David O'Meara, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Won two nice races at York last year and seems to like the place. He's had some good runs this season and probably paid the price late on for going too fast at Ripon last time. He'll be kept going in the nice sprint handicaps, including at York. 10-05-21

runners.name: Rapido Girl
runners.comment: Fifth of eight on stable debut at Wolverhampton 13 days ago and should run well
runners.spotlight: Won once and placed four times last year for Craig Lidster; encouraging fifth of eight on stable debut at Wolverhampton (6f, AW) 13 days ago and should not be far away.

runners.name: Taygar
runners.comment: May have found ground too quick when eighth of 11 at Doncaster last month
runners.spotlight: Won twice last year including over C&D (soft) in November off 3lb lower mark; may have found the ground on the quick side when eighth of 11 on seasonal debut at Doncaster (5f, good to firm) last month and may suffer the same fate here.

stable_tour.quote: I haven't done too much with my 2yos but this filly actually won first time out for us back in April. I don't usually have many youngsters out at that time of the year but she was showing a lot of speed and won well. Her next run at Pontefract was a different story as she was too keen and gave herself no chance, while at Redcar last time out she encountered good to firm ground for the first time and although she ran well, I felt she would appreciate a little more cut. We will look to upping her in trip to 6f next and find some slower ground. 26-07-23

runners.name: Running Cool
runners.comment: Has struggled for his current yard since coming from Ireland where he won twice in 2023
runners.spotlight: Has struggled for his current yard since coming from Ireland where he won twice in 2023; hard to fancy despite a falling mark.

stable_tour.quote: We're very happy with him. He's a strong horse who's joined us from Ireland and has been gelded since - he'll be better for that. He's from the family of Jamarj, who did so well for my father, and he's quick. 23-04-24

runners.name: Dandy Dinmont

prev_owners.owner: Mps Racing, The Olliers, S Perkins

runners.comment: Hasn't been beaten far in three starts this year but needs a strong pace to show his best
runners.spotlight: Last win came at Doncaster last July off 5lb higher mark; hasn't been beaten far in three starts this year but needs a strong pace in order to utilise his finishing kick; not out of this on a career-low mark.

stable_tour.quote: He was last of six at Doncaster last week and wasn't like he usually is. He's very genuine and has been flying at home, so I hope that effort will prove to be a one-off. He's a really likeable horse and I think he'll have a great chance wherever he ends up next. 27-07-22

runners.name: One Of Our Own
runners.comment: Has finished close up on her last two starts and she should go close
runners.spotlight: C&D winner in 2023 and scored three times at Catterick last year, the last off this mark; has finished close up on her last two starts and she should go close.

runners.name: Bayraat
runners.comment: 1-21 under rules and doesn't strike as the sort to win following an eight-month absence
runners.spotlight: 1-21 under rules and doesn't strike as the sort to win following an eight-month absence.

runners.name: Happier
runners.comment: Below-par this year including when seventh at Thirsk on Saturday
runners.spotlight: Below-par this year including when seventh at Thirsk on Saturday when cheekpieces worn twice in 2023 were back on (retained) alongside the regular tongue-tie; more required.

runners.name: Papa Cocktail
runners.comment: Yet to make the frame since returning from 16-month absence for current trainer
runners.spotlight: Rattled off three straight wins in 2023 for Stella Barclay but yet to make the frame since returning from 16-month absence for current trainer; others preferred.

stable_tour.quote: I think he is a very nice colt with a bright future. His work had been encouraging this spring and we started him off over 7f late last month at Yarmouth in what looked a particularly hot maiden, with several of the big yards represented and many trainers liking their charges. He ran a cracker to be third behind New Science, where he was rather green but ran on well. It was the perfect start to his career as he will have learned plenty and mentally handled things well. There are a few 7f maidens around Royal Ascot time later this month and we will pick our spot to make him a winner and take it from there. He runs in the colours of owner Khalifa Dasmal, who is a great man to train for. His patronage is largely thanks to my former guv'nor David Simcock giving him a nod in my direction. David has been a huge help to me in my career and I am very hopeful that I have a potentially nice horse here for Mr Dasmal. 10-06-21

runners.spotlight: Ran out of steam when trying to make all over 7f and 6f recently; this drop back to 5f makes sense but there to be shot at.

runners.spotlight: Made encouraging handicap debut when second of seven at Ayr (5f, good) three weeks ago; still early days and first-time hood goes on; should run his race.

runners.name: Kawthar

runners.name: Maasai Mata

runners.name: Bellator Bullet

runners.comment: Showed improved form up in trip when second of four at Newcastle last month.
runners.spotlight: Showed improved form up in trip when second of four at Newcastle (12.5f, AW) last month; holds place claims.

runners.name: Arie Gordye
runners.comment: Yet to be placed from five starts but being by an Arc winner she ought to improve in time.
runners.spotlight: Yet to be placed from five starts but being by an Arc winner she ought to do better in time; first-time cheekpieces now go on.

runners.name: West Wickham

runners.spotlight: Yet to make the frame from six starts for George Scott; makes stable debut and first-time cheekpieces replace blinkers; best watched.

runners.name: Cantalice

runners.spotlight: Has beaten only two in three novice/maiden fillies' races; makes turf/handicap debut and cheekpieces worn for the first time on her latest start are persevered with; needs to show more.

runners.name: Jedhi Knight
runners.comment: Down the field in three novice/maiden races this year at big odds; steps up in trip.

runners.name: Time For Dessert

runners.spotlight: Has beaten only two in three novice fillies' contests this year; steps up in trip on handicap debut in first-time blinkers and best watched.

runners.name: Flamborough Head
runners.comment: Won handicap debut over 1m here; more to do since but has 7f form; less to prove than some
runners.spotlight: Won first turf handicap, over 1m here in April, and he's had more on his plate against improvers/unexposed rivals since, albeit he drew well clear with one on a four-timer at Ripon (good; first-time cheekpieces, retained) last time; had 7f form on AW; has less to prove than some.

runners.name: Vesperado
runners.comment: Signs of ability but needs much more than shown in two 7f handicaps this year; aids switch
runners.spotlight: Signs of ability as 2yo but he doesn't help himself by hanging and needs much more than shown in two handicaps at about 7f this year, in a hood and cheekpieces latest, now blinkered.

runners.name: Mister Sky Blue
runners.comment: Looked promising when 6f winner latest; finished strongly so worth another go at 7f
runners.spotlight: Looked a sprinter to follow when a ready winner of second 3yo start, at Hamilton (6f, good to firm) recently but the way he coped with that stiff finish suggests he should be effective back at 7f too; dangerous.

stable_tour.quote: He was third at Pontefract last week on his first run of the season. He gave away a lot of ground and had a bad draw, so hopefully he'll improve on last year's form. It looks as though he's gone the right way over the winter, so hopefully he can get his head in front soon. 23-04-25

runners.name: Weve Got This
runners.comment: Keeping-on 4th on AW (7f) latest; entitled to come on for the run; not far away
runners.spotlight: Not yet established her best trip but she kept on well enough when fourth over 7f on Southwell AW for new yard in April and entitled to come on for the run now tackling her first turf handicap; not far away.

runners.name: Yorkshire Myth
runners.comment: Came home nicely in 7f handicap debut on AW; looks likely to improve with experience
runners.spotlight: Was making hard work of it from some way out on recent handicap debut at Southwell (7f, AW) but he did come home nicely in sixth; should improve with experience but perhaps not enough for win purposes today.

runners.name: Dovey Moon
runners.comment: Thereabouts in 7f handicaps on AW/turf; beaten fair way out at Doncaster on Saturday
runners.spotlight: Thereabouts in 7f handicaps on AW and turf this year and he gave a plucky display when just missing out on a place in a blanket finish on Southwell AW 19 days ago; however, he didn't look a turf winner in waiting at Doncaster (1m) on Saturday.

runners.name: Perfidia
runners.comment: Running well over 6f, doing good late work here last month; has a part to play back at 7f
runners.spotlight: Has yet to prove stamina for this far but he's been running well in 6f handicaps this year and did good late work behind the front-running winner here (good to firm) last month; perhaps this trip will suit with another winter under his belt; has a part to play.

runners.name: Makes Me Wonder
runners.comment: Solid 1m winner on turf debut; form worked out; up just 4lb; interesting back at 7f
runners.spotlight: Well connected and although his AW form was modest it was a different story on turf debut at Yarmouth (1m, good) when despite being denied the run he wanted he found a bright finish to beat one who landed a four-timer after; interesting back at 7f off just 4lb higher.

runners.name: Sharon Curly
runners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd
runners.comment: Respectable 5th on first 7f run; needs extra but not impossible she'll find it
runners.spotlight: Still early days but while her first 7f run, when fifth on Wolverhampton AW last time, was perfectly respectable she needs more for the return to turf; not impossible that she'll find extra for this yard, though.

runners.name: I Can Boogy
runners.comment: Best form on AW, 2nd over 7f before 1m win; held on turf since; return to 7f could suit
runners.spotlight: Best form on Tapeta earlier, when runner-up over 7f before 1m win; little between her and Flamborough Head on 1m running here in April but subsequent C&D run was less convincing; perhaps 7f will suit better on turf.

runners.name: I Got Know How
runners.comment: Two fair 6f runs this year but not obviously well treated  back at 7f; first-time headgear
runners.spotlight: Two fair efforts in 6f turf handicaps this year, just keeping on at one pace at Ripon this month; has something to prove back at 7f in first-time cheekpieces.

runners.name: Caledonian Dream
runners.comment: Has possibilities off this mark on pick of 2yo form but made slow start for this yard
runners.spotlight: Has possibilities off this mark on the pick of his 1m form for previous yard but he's made a slow start for this one, without and with headgear; minor claims.

runners.name: Novello Lad
runners.comment: Shaped encouragingly when fifth of eight on seasonal debut at Doncaster
runners.spotlight: Sole success was at Doncaster last June off 4lb lower mark; shaped encouragingly following wind surgery when fifth of eight on seasonal debut at Doncaster (6f, good to firm) and should come on for that run.

stable_tour.quote: We inherited him last backend and he grew and matured over the winter. His first run of the year at Doncaster was pretty solid and he finished third. He stepped forward from that at Thirsk last time, when he did everything wrong but still finished a close third. Only a neck separated him and the second and there was another neck to the winner.  If he'd done things right I'm sure he'd have won but he's just a big, raw, slow-maturing horse and I expect him to step forward quite considerably as the year goes on. He's better than his mark. He's entered at Doncaster on Friday. 28-06-24

runners.name: Deputy
runners.comment: Rounded off last year with win over C&D (soft) in October off 5lb lower mark
runners.spotlight: Rounded off last year with win over C&D (soft) in October off 5lb lower mark; yet to run on ground quicker than good; may have conditions against him.

runners.name: Willolarupi
runners.comment: Scored twice last year and shaped well when second of ten at Wetherby last month
runners.spotlight: Scored twice last year and shaped well when second of ten at Wetherby (5.5f, good to firm) last month; needs a fast-run race to show his best.

runners.name: Fletchers Dream
runners.owner: The Jocks And The Geordies Ii

prev_owners.owner: S McMillan, S Boyle & A D Brown

runners.comment: Both wins have been on AW; well-held on seasonal debut at Thirsk last month
runners.spotlight: Both wins have been on AW; well-held on seasonal debut at Thirsk (1m, good) last month; drops back in trip but may be best watched until he returns to AW.

runners.name: Profiteer
runners.comment: Won three last year but well held on two runs this term
runners.spotlight: Won three last year but well held on two runs this term; still 1lb higher than for his last win; best watched.

runners.name: Sugar Baby
runners.owner: Hard Held Partnership And Angus Racing

prev_owners.owner: Angus Racing Club & P D Niven

runners.comment: Has returned from a nine-month absence to win twice this year, latest here 18 days ago
runners.spotlight: Has returned from a nine-month absence to win twice this year, the latest here (5f, good to firm) 18 days ago; has never raced beyond 5f but runs as though this longer trip should suit; interesting off 3lb higher mark.

runners.name: Cuban Storm
runners.comment: Course winner but last of ten on seasonal debut at Wetherby last month
runners.spotlight: Sole success came here (5f, good to firm) last May; not so good since and finished last of ten on seasonal debut at Wetherby (5.5f, good to firm) last month; needs to show more.

runners.name: Nazalan
runners.comment: Makes seasonal/stable debut and headgear worn previously is absent; best watched
runners.spotlight: Below his best when trained by Sean Woods last year; makes seasonal/stable debut and headgear worn previously is absent; best watched.

runners.name: Kode Secret
runners.breeder: Ghs Bloodstock Ltd & Tally Ho Stud
runners.comment: No show in two starts this term and needs to show improvement
runners.spotlight: Second of two wins last year was here (7f, good to firm) last June off 2lb lower mark; no show in two starts this term and needs to show improvement.

2:15.race_name: racingtv.com EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Band D) (EBF Qualifier) (GBB/IRE Incentive Race) (Div II)
2:15.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 8.7) (Watered)
2:15.stalls: Straight course - Stands' side; Round course - Inside

runners.name: Calafiori
runners.comment: Stepped up on his debut run when second of 13 at Leicester nine days ago.
runners.spotlight: Stepped up on his debut run when second of 13 at Leicester (5f, good to firm) nine days ago and must enter calculations.

runners.name: Davvy
runners.comment: Showed improvement on his turf debut when fourth of ten at Chester 11 days ago.
runners.spotlight: Showed significant improvement on his turf debut when fourth of ten at Chester (5.5f, good; 50-1) 11 days ago, leading until headed over 1f out; a repeat of that run should put him in the firing line here.

runners.name: Oh West Virginia
runners.comment: Not much to shout about following two runs and needs to show improvement.
runners.spotlight: Not much to shout about following two runs and needs to show improvement.

runners.name: The Caddy Master
runners.comment: Always in rear when ninth of 12 on debut at Beverley but looks sure to improve.
runners.spotlight: Always in rear when ninth of 12 on debut at Beverley (5f, good to firm) but looks sure to improve and one to watch out for.

runners.name: Carnation Queen
runners.comment: Yard have had a 2yo debut winner this season and she needs watching in market
runners.spotlight: Cotai Glory filly; third foal; dam placed 6f-1m (including 2yo/AW; RPR 77), half-sister to Listed-placed 6f/7f winner The Gold Cheongsam, out of Listed-placed 1m-9.4f winner; yard have had a 2yo debut winner this season and she needs watching in market.

runners.name: Lope Y Linda
runners.comment: Took a backward step on her second start when hanging left-handed at Beverley.
runners.spotlight: Took a backward step on her second start when hanging left-handed at Beverley (5f, good to firm) two weeks ago when eighth of 12; should do better in time.

runners.name: Miss Apres
runners.comment: Yard amongst the winners this month but still to have a juvenile winner this season
runners.spotlight: Third foal by Inns Of Court; half-sister to Scandinavian 5.5f/6f winner Soup Or Sonic; dam 2yo sprint maiden (RPR 59), sister to UAE 6f Group 1 winner Krypton Factor, out of 6f 2yo Listed winner; yard amongst the winners this month but still yet to have a juvenile winner this season; best watched on debut.

runners.name: Muddy Nora
runners.comment: Always in rear on debut over C&D last month and needs to show significant improvement.
runners.spotlight: Always in rear on debut over C&D (good; 80-1) last month and needs to show significant improvement.

runners.name: Sister Lizzie
runners.comment: Got the hang of things late on when fifth of ten on debut at Thirsk 16 days ago.
runners.spotlight: Got the hang of things late on when fifth of ten on debut at Thirsk (5f, good) 16 days ago and will know more this time; has to be of interest.

9:00.race_name: Advance Price Midweek Racing For £10 Handicap

runners.name: Novak
runners.comment: Recorded his ninth win when scoring over C&D last month; big player again up 3lb
runners.spotlight: Nine wins and 21 placed efforts from his 65 starts and latest success was over C&D last month; up 3lb but he remains feasibly treated and should be in the thick of things again.

runners.name: Lady Wingalong
runners.comment: Made it 6-17 for David Evans when completing double here latest; respected back up in trip
runners.spotlight: Made it 6-17 for David Evans when completing a double here (6f) in March; 5lb higher after a short break but this step back up in trip is no problem and she could continue on an upward curve; strongly respected.

runners.name: Sustained
runners.comment: C&D winner who still has potential and he needs watching in market on his return
runners.spotlight: C&D winner on debut last June and he ended last season with three respectable efforts in 7f handicaps; hasn't really progressed so far but he still has potential and needs watching in market back from 242 days off.

runners.name: Rogue Soldier
runners.comment: Dual AW winner but he struggled on stable debut last month and others are preferred
runners.spotlight: Two AW wins for former stables, including a 1m handicap at Lingfield last June; only 1lb higher than for that success but he reappeared with a heavy defeat at Chelmsford (7f) last month and has something to prove after that; cheekpieces removed.

runners.name: Twilight Diamond
runners.comment: Still unexposed and tongue-tie is now added but he needs to raise his game back on AW
runners.spotlight: Won small-field novice here (6f) on debut in January but he's been well held switched to handicaps (6f/7f) in last two runs; still unexposed and tongue-tie is now added but he needs to significantly raise his game back on AW.

runners.name: Animate
runners.owner: Tom Goodair, Jimmy Kay, John Beamson
runners.comment: Won at Catterick last June but he's been generally disappointing since; non-runner
runners.spotlight: C&D winner who scored off 4lb higher at Catterick last June but he's been generally disappointing since and was last of nine at Catterick last month; slipped at the start in that race but he's drawn out wide back on AW and others are preferred; non-runner.

quotes.race: 5th Regiment Royal Artillery Handicap
quotes.quote: When I first got Animate I thought he was going to be a proper horse. He's been a bit disappointing, but I've taken the extra headgear off and he's loved it today. That's the first time he's won on turf, hopefully he can take off from it. I haven't had him that long, but I've found the key to him and he'll go forward now -  Geoffrey Harker, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: City Cyclone
runners.comment: Triple C&D winner who had a near-miss at Lingfield last time and is only 1lb higher here
runners.spotlight: All three wins have been over C&D and last two were in January; has been a bit up and down since his last win but he hit a personal best with his near-miss at Lingfield last time and is only 1lb higher back at this track; interesting contender.

runners.name: Chifa

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late J P Carrington

runners.comment: Five-time C&D winner who went close off this mark at Chelmsford latest; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Five of his six AW wins have been gained over C&D; missed last year but he's been placed in two of his three runs since returning from a long absence, including a close third at Chelmsford last time; on unchanged mark and he's in the mix back on Tapeta.

runners.name: Swiss Ace

prev_owners.owner: The Bottom Liners & Mrs R Carr
Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor

runners.comment: On lengthy losing run but was an eyecatching third at Southwell latest; dangerous
runners.spotlight: On lengthy losing run and has had a few false dawns since November but he made encouraging late headway when third at Southwell (Tapeta; blinkers reapplied) last month; that was an eyecatching effort over 6f and has claims if he can back that up.

stable_tour.quote: We all know what aeat sire Kingman is but not everyone remembers Swiss Lake, who was a two-time Listed winner. Despite hereeding, Swiss Ace still has a lot to prove being without a win since December 2023. Finished mid-division at Redcar on Monday and should progress. 09-04-25

runners.name: Harbour Vision
runners.comment: 13-time AW winner who went close over C&D on his penultimate run; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: 13-time AW winner who is 1-24 on turf; well-held third of five at Brighton last time but he went close behind Novak over C&D on his penultimate run and has claims if he can recapture that form.

quotes.race: Stay Safe Players With BetMGM Handicap
quotes.quote: Harbour Vision knows his way round here better than all of us! He jumped well enough but there was plenty of pace and he really settled for me. The gap opened up on the inside and he was away - Taryn Langley, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

8:00.race_name: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Fillies' Handicap

runners.name: Tiger Tulip
runners.comment: C&D winner; not fired in two runs this year but she's becoming well treated
runners.spotlight: C&D win as a 2yo; has plenty of handicapping potential on last year's best but she has been disappointing in two runs this year; others look safer despite the reduced mark.

quotes.race: At The Races App Market Movers Restricted Maiden Fillies' Stakes (Bands C-D 3 Runs Or Fewer) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Everything went smoothly. Tiger Tulip was away nicely and we just took a tow into the race off the favourite. She's still very inexperienced so I thought I'd squeeze her in between two (rivals) in the home straight and she picked up nicely - Cieren Fallon, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Gabriae
runners.comment: Ran well on her stable/seasonal/handicap debut here (5f) last month; each-way shout
runners.spotlight: Promise as a 3yo for Barry Brennan; had undergone wind surgery prior to her stable/seasonal/handicap debut over 5f here three weeks ago (first run for 366 days) and she ran well for second; same mark and she should be fine back at 6f; not discounted.

runners.name: The Real Mckay
runners.comment: Two 6f AW wins for I Furtado in 2024; not shone for new yard yet but may do soon
runners.spotlight: Two AW wins for Ivan Furtado last year; hasn't hit top gear in three runs for her new stable but edging down the weights and she'll appreciate the return to 6f.

runners.name: Gogo Yubari

prev_owners.owner: Gee Gee's Wine Bar & Dylan Cunha

runners.comment: Down in the weights but she's yet to shine for Tony Carroll; others are more appealing
runners.spotlight: C&D winner who lurks on a dangerous mark, mainly as a result of showing little in three runs for her new yard this spring; likely to come good against soon but others are more appealing tonight.

quotes.race: Free Digital Racecard At raceday-ready.com Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: We paid five grand for Gogo Yubari at the mares' sale and we've won five races and had two places from ten starts in four months; it's been unreal - Dylan Cunha, trainer.

runners.name: Medinilla
runners.comment: Two runs as a 2yo, scoring at Ripon (6f, soft) on second occasion; unexposed & interesting
runners.spotlight: She made a promising debut at Newbury last September and duly improved to win a Ripon maiden (6f, soft) eight days later; challenged widest and didn't look in love with the track on that occasion so the run should probably be upgraded a touch; moves into handicaps with potential.

quotes.race: Theakstons Best EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands B, C And D) (EBF Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I liked Medinilla the first time and she's come on a tremendous amount at home. If she handled the track I was fairly confident she'd run well. If you hit one ridge here, you hit all of them. We didn't get into the flow until the last furlong, so you can only be pleased. They've done well to nurture her to this point as next year is when she'll flourish - Jack Channon, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: She won very well the other day at Ripon over 6f and we were happy that she managed to score on only her second start. We might look at one more race for her before we wrap her up and she'll be a nice filly next year. 10-10-24

runners.name: Forteleza
runners.comment: Effective over C&D and made a fair return to action last month; not obviously well treated
runners.spotlight: Placed twice as a 2yo, including C&D, and she made a satisfactory seasonal return when sixth at Windsor three weeks ago; drawn wide here though and may need some more weight off her back.

runners.name: Sunshine Soul
runners.comment: Not progressing and the addition of blinkers isn't enough to earn her the vote
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden who isn't progressing; handicapper easing her burden and she's now tried in blinkers but she needs to rebound from a couple of poor runs.

runners.name: Princess Pw
runners.owner: Miss P Wothersoon, Michael Watt, B Crew

prev_owners.owner: Miss P Wotherspoon & Michael H Watt

runners.comment: Consistent six-race maiden; improvement required for this first crack at sprinting
runners.spotlight: 0-6 but she's consistent and ran right up to her best at Lingfield last month (7f, AW; blinkered first time); drops to 6f for the first time; not obviously thrown in though.

runners.name: Spring
runners.owner: Thorpe, Henwood, Regan & Mrs J Blake
runners.comment: Unexposed 3yo; shaped nicely on her Lingfield return (5f, AW) last month; solid contender
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 3yo; shaped with a degree of promise when keeping on for a close fifth at Lingfield (5f, AW) on her return last month; should be sharper today and returning to 6f will help; leading contender.

runners.name: Midnight Call
runners.comment: Modest form in 3 AW runs for C Johnston in 2024; sold 1,000gns last April; best watched
runners.spotlight: Modest form in three AW runs (6f-1m) for Charlie Johnston in the first half of 2024; sold for 1,000gns after the third of them; absent for 410 days and likely best watched on stable/handicap debut.

runners.name: Jake Loves Laura
runners.comment: Seven-race maiden; sold for 1,200gns last month; drawn widest on yard debut; best watched
runners.spotlight: 0-7 for two other yards but her two best runs came over 6f on AW; drawn widest on this stable debut (sold for 1,200gns last month) after a ten-week break; likely best watched.

runners.name: Rinky Tinky Tinky
runners.comment: Easy win at Nottingham (6f, good to firm) on stable debut; this is tougher but unexposed
runners.spotlight: Came from off the pace to record an easy win at Nottingham on her stable/seasonal debut at Nottingham three weeks ago (6f, good to firm); 4lb higher mark against stronger opposition tonight but she's not exposed.

runners.name: Rock N Roll Rocket
runners.comment: 2lb lower than for his win in December but it's generally been a struggle since
runners.spotlight: 2lb lower than for his Southwell win in December (6f) but patchy form thereafter; too much to prove for comfort.

runners.name: Em Four
runners.comment: 6f win at Chelmsford in January; well held in two handicaps later that month; gelded since
runners.spotlight: Made all to win a 6f maiden at Chelmsford in January; no impact in two handicaps later that month, after which he was gelded; dropped 3lb but needs improvement for the drop to 5f and he's drawn widest.

runners.name: Emporess
runners.comment: 1-10 at two but left impression there was more in the tank; market to guide; stable debut
runners.spotlight: Just one win from ten starts as a 2yo, namely a 5.7f heavy-ground nursery at Bath in October; held her form afterwards and could yet prove better than this mark; betting to guide now starting out for Tony Carroll (same owner).

runners.name: Solar Edge
runners.comment: Two wins last year, including a defeat of Natsumi at Lingfield; slow start to 2025
runners.spotlight: Won two 5f nurseries last year, including an impressive defeat of Natsumi at Lingfield (AW); yet to fire this year but edging down the weights.

runners.name: Natsumi
runners.breeder: The Out Of The Flames Partnership
runners.comment: Two 5f AW wins to her name; not at best on turf last time but this looks more suitable
runners.spotlight: Two wins in 5f AW handicaps, the latest in March (off 2lb lower) after a three-month break; not so good on turf at Catterick six weeks ago but returning to AW should help.

runners.name: Sultan Of Oj
runners.comment: One 2yo run that offers hope he's on a fair mark; market to guide on stable/handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Big prices and well held in three sprint runs on turf for the Moores last summer; faces a more realistic assignment on his stable/handicap debut and his Windsor seventh on his second run offers hope this mark is in range; betting to guide.

runners.name: Triple Charged
runners.comment: Yet to find his best in three runs for current yard; down in weights but opposable
runners.spotlight: Showed winning potential for Karl Burke but he's finished in rear in three starts for his current stable; down in the weights but a seven-week break needs to have freshened him up.

runners.name: Startling
runners.comment: Three nursery wins last year, including C&D; running well in defeat this year; e-w shout
runners.spotlight: Won three Class 6 nurseries last year, including C&D, and she's run some good races this time around too; beaten half a length into third (of four) over C&D three weeks ago, ending up quite wide given the small field; each-way shout.

runners.name: Son Of Astar
runners.comment: 0-7 but did show some promise as a 2yo; gelded prior to return; stable run two here
runners.spotlight: Bits of form as a 2yo that suggest he can win races; gelded prior to his return from a 223-day absence; stable also represented by Emporess.

stable_tour.quote: We've only got five or six juveniles. He's the one who's the most forward, the rest are a little bit slow to come to hand. He was fifth the other day when topweight in a nursery at Leicester behind Tees Aggregates. He ran okay but the ground was probably a bit quick for him. He's been fourth a couple of two-year-old before the season's end.times too and I'm pretty sure he'll win as a 07-08-24

7:30.race_name: Enjoy Summer Racing At Wolverhampton Racecourse Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands C & D) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Azure Zain
runners.comment: Held as favourite at Hamilton but he ran green and is a likely improver upped in trip
runners.spotlight: Out of a well-related 6f winner and he cost 80,000euros (breeze-up) as a 2yo; finished third of five when favourite at Hamilton (5f, good to firm) 15 days ago, but he looked inexperienced and was only beaten around 2l; should know more this time and he's a likely improver upped in trip.

runners.name: Lexington Jet
runners.comment: Has struggled in all three runs and has lots to find on this drop back in trip
runners.spotlight: Struggled in both 2yo runs and same story with hood added in a 7f maiden here (25-1) on recent comeback; has lots to find on this drop back in trip and remains best watched for now.

stable_tour.quote: Owned by Middleham Park, he made his debut at Thirsk and just didn't handle the good to soft ground. He's shown a lot at home, I'm a big fan of his and have loved him since the day he came into the yard. He'll run again soon and could be an exciting colt if we can keep a lid on him as he's got a big engine. 30-05-24

runners.name: Mister Invincible
runners.comment: His latest third at Ayr puts him firmly in the picture and he's respected on AW debut
runners.spotlight: Made an encouraging debut when fifth at Ripon (6f, good) last month and he built on that with a front-running third behind a 1-3 shot at Ayr (6f, good to firm); that latest form puts him firmly in the picture and he's respected on this switch to AW.

runners.name: William Marshal
runners.comment: RPRs in the low 40s when beaten around 13l in his two runs (6f/7f) last month; opposable
runners.spotlight: RPRs in the low 40s when beaten around 13l in his two runs (6f/7f) last month and latest was at this track; opposable.

runners.name: Flash Harry
runners.comment: Went close in sole 2yo run and he's a key player on comeback for new yard; hood added
runners.spotlight: 50-1 for Bath debut (5.7f, good to firm) last June, but he made a bold bid before finishing a close second behind a subsequent triple Listed winner; left Sylvester Kirk since and has been gelded; hood is now added on his comeback, but he has leading claims on his debut form and is a key player for new yard.

runners.name: Fidget Lady
runners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd
runners.comment: Made a low-key start at Southwell and needs to leave that form miles behind; yard runs two
runners.spotlight: Closely related to a useful 7f winner for the same yard, but she made a low-key start at Southwell (6f, Tapeta) last month and needs to leave that form miles behind; stablemate of Azure Zain.

runners.name: Piddies Pearl
runners.comment: Big prices and hasn't shown much in her two runs this spring including over C&D last time
runners.spotlight: Big prices and hasn't shown much in her two runs this spring including over C&D last time; hood is now added and she needs a transformation.

runners.name: Your Love
runners.comment: Went close on recent Chelmsford debut and she should improve for that experience
runners.spotlight: First foal of a 6f/7f winner (including AW; RPR 93); well backed into 2-1 at Chelmsford (6f, AW) 11 days ago and she came from off the pace to finish a close second behind the favourite; that was a promising start and she should improve for the experience.

runners.name: Important
runners.comment: Showed some ability at Kempton but she needs lots of progress dropped in trip; headgear on
runners.spotlight: 5,000gns yearling; showed some ability on recent Kempton debut (7f) but was beaten around 6l in that race and she needs lots of improvement on this drop in trip; blinkers added.

runners.name: Invincible Ruby
runners.comment: Two promising efforts at Catterick (7f) this spring but she has quite a bit to find here
runners.spotlight: Two promising efforts over 7f at Catterick (good to firm) this spring, the latest when a front-running third last Monday; should be fine on this drop in trip but she has quite a bit to find on this switch to AW and others are preferred.

runners.name: Miss Yorkshire
runners.comment: Placed in both her runs but she needs improvement to make a big impact back on AW
runners.spotlight: Promising second on her Newcastle debut (7f, AW) in October and she ran to a similar level when third at Ripon (6f, good) on her return last month; should go well again but she needs improvement to make a big impact back on Tapeta.

stable_tour.quote: She's a big filly who has wintered well. She finished second on her debut at Newcastle in October and then was third at Ripon last week over 6f. She'll probably be seen to best effect up in trip but we're just trying to get her to sharpen up and race into the bridle at the moment. I think she'll be a nice filly down the line. 23-04-25

7:00.race_name: Play At The Races Stableduel Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Getreadytorumble
runners.breeder: P Taplin & Mike Channon Bloodstock Ltd
runners.comment: Dropped away to be beaten over 10l on recent Kempton debut (6f); big step forward needed
runners.spotlight: 50-1 for his Kempton debut (6f) two weeks ago, dropping away in the straight and beaten over 10l at the finish; big step forward needed.

runners.name: Marty Hopkirk
runners.comment: Didn't run as badly as the bare figures suggest on recent Kempton debut (6f)
runners.spotlight: 50-1 and beaten 18l at the finish on his Kempton debut two weeks ago (6f; behind Getreadytorumble), but he was too free early and raced wide throughout so the run can certainly be upgraded a touch; interesting to see if he's stronger in the betting this time.

stable_tour.quote: A full-brother to Commander Straker, he's a few weeks away from starting but looks pretty smart. He's a nicer stamp of a horse than his brother, he looks a lot more athletic. He's a big strong colt and I think he'll be pretty decent. 30-05-24

runners.name: Nacho Nacho Nacho
runners.comment: Looked a tricky ride at Kempton last time; debut effort not without hope though
runners.spotlight: Debut third at Nottingham (6f, good) was encouraging, but he took a backwards step at Kempton four weeks ago (looked a tricky ride); others appeal more.

runners.name: Rock Iguana
runners.comment: 575,000euros yearling; bred to be useful and makes his debut at a modest level
runners.spotlight: 575,000euros yearling; seventh foal; closely related to 1m/9.5f 2yo winner Next Factor (including AW; RPR 90), half-brother to winners Lady Galore (5f Listed/5.5f 2yo; 96), Tikitiki (7f AW 2yo; 93) and Aiza (Moroccan 6.5f/9.5f); dam US 1m AW/dirt winner; makes his debut at a modest level and he's of obvious interest on paper.

runners.name: Speed Of Maajid
runners.comment: Second 2yo run better than his first; gelded since last seen; more to come this year
runners.spotlight: Well beaten at Glorious Goodwood on debut last summer; better form when second of four at Chepstow last September; gelded afterwards; more to come this year but he will need to fare better to take this.

runners.name: Ziggys Triton
runners.comment: Second to useful sort on his sole 2yo start; sets the standard but it's not a daunting one
runners.spotlight: Promising second of ten at Ripon (winner useful) on his debut 303 days ago (5f, good to soft); gelded in January; that effort sets the standard, albeit not a daunting one, and he's open to further progress.

runners.name: Hattal
runners.comment: 320,000gns sister to French Listed winner; dam a Group-placed winner; likely type on paper
runners.spotlight: 95,000gns foal, 320,000gns yearling; fourth foal, sister to French 4.5f and 5f (Listed) 2yo winner The Fixer (RPR 95), half-sister to 5.5f-6.5f winner Faro De San Juan (99); dam Group-placed 4.5f 2yo winner (102); hooded for debut; looks a likely type on paper and one to note in the market.

runners.name: Honest Courtesan
runners.comment: Third of six in two AW runs this spring; needs more and she has a wide stall to overcome
runners.spotlight: Two runs in 5f AW events this spring, finishing third of six on both occasions; drawn wide and others have more appealing claims.

runners.name: La Lunita
runners.comment: 300-1 and offered little on her Southwell debut last August (5f)
runners.spotlight: 300-1 and offered little on her Southwell debut last August (5f).

runners.name: Money Pockets
runners.comment: Showed speed at Southwell 18 days ago but ended up finishing fourth; others look stronger
runners.spotlight: Showed speed at Southwell 18 days ago before tiring late on (finished behind Honest Courtesan); drawn widest and others look stronger.

runners.name: Princess Vivi
runners.comment: Third foal of a 7f AW winner (RPR 90); stable not known for winning newcomers
runners.spotlight: Third foal; dam 7f AW 2yo winner (RPR 90), half-sister to useful 6f/7f winner Bounty Quest; stable not renowned for winning newcomers.

6:30.race_name: Weekend Winners On At The Races Apprentice Handicap

runners.name: Corsican Caper
runners.comment: Sole AW win in a classified event but 10lb lower than 2m turf win in September; involved
runners.spotlight: Well treated on turf form, such as when winning at Chester (2m) in September off 10lb higher, but he rarely shines on AW and his sole win on sand came in a classified; should still be involved at this level, though.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: Corsican Caper loves this type of ground, so he'll probably keep going through the autumn. He's not hard on himself and hopefully there's a bit of improvement in him. He'll cope with a bigger track as well and anything from a mile-six to two miles will suit him - Kevin Frost, trainer.

runners.name: Queensland Boy
runners.comment: 2m turf winner in 2024 but pulled up over hurdles latest and in poor form on AW previously
runners.spotlight: 2m turf winner last spring but pulled up over hurdles when last seen in February and had been in poor form on AW previously; risky.

runners.name: Roi De Baviere
runners.comment: In the frame over 1m2f-1m4f in France; has gone walkabout over hurdles and on AW of late
runners.spotlight: In the frame at 1m2f-1m4f in France last year; initially ran quite promisingly over hurdles in Britain but he's gone walkabout this year, including on AW in April; has it to prove at present.

runners.name: Adrian
runners.comment: Group 3 winner in Germany; retains ability but returns from another break
runners.spotlight: Listed/Group 3 winner in Germany much earlier in career; hard to know what ability remains but he was highly tried in previous AW runs and there were signs of life when he made late headway at Ffos Las (2m) last July before heavy ground was against him in October; blinkers return; interesting.

runners.name: Man Of Riddles
runners.comment: Three 2m wins on AW, including here; mixed since last win and well held over C&D latest
runners.spotlight: Three 2m wins on AW including one over C&D; now 11lb lower than the latest of them in January 2024, but he rather comes and goes and might have run better over C&D latest (first-time hood, now discarded).

runners.name: New York Bay
runners.owner: Paul F Arun R Keith C

prev_owners.owner: Matthew S Paul F Arun R Keith C
Matthew S Paul F Arun R Keith C & Gay K

runners.comment: Won 2nd and 3rd handicaps at 1m6f; stayed 2m when last seen in February 2024; interesting
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced and off since February 2024 but he won his second and third handicaps, at about 1m6f here and at Chelmsford, and he did good late work when upped to 2m at Lingfield when last seen; interesting contender.

stable_tour.quote: I like him very much. He won two races at around 1m6f at Wolverhampton and Chelmsford in January but since February he's had a holiday. He's always been a backward horse. I think he's probably one of my best-handicapped horses- thank God! He's only going to improve and get stronger as he gets older. He's a big horse and will probably end up jumping in due course. 08-05-24

runners.name: Leon Trotsky
runners.comment: Promising win on first 2m start at Southwell; good 3rd there latest; solid option
runners.spotlight: Had little trouble in shaking off his rivals when upped to 2m at Southwell in February and he ran a sound race in defeat when third over that C&D in April; looks one of the better options if proving suited by this track on first run here.

runners.name: Triple Nickle
runners.comment: Turf win at 2m in August but AW form is mixed and below best over hurdles of late
runners.spotlight: Won off a similar mark on turf (2m) in August, but she's run some ordinary races on the AW since finishing close up at Kempton in January 2024 and recent hurdle efforts raise questions about her current form.

quotes.race: MansionBet Preparing For A Merry Cheltmas Mares' Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Triple Nickle likes the soft ground and had that Flat speed at the end - Robert Williams, jockey.

runners.name: Drouthy Neebor
runners.comment: Maiden; placed in last five handicaps and tough task over 1m6f latest; Tapeta debut
runners.spotlight: Not yet off the mark, but he's been placed in his last five handicaps and had little hope against a subsequent wide-margin winner at Chelmsford (1m6f) when back from a break; has stamina still to prove on Tapeta debut but this is realistic.

runners.name: Chef De Troupe
runners.comment: Two C&D wins among multiple successes; better for recent return over C&D
runners.spotlight: Two C&D wins among multiple successes, the latest over hurdles last May; ran well for a long way over C&D in April on return from another break, and a good run looks more likely from him than some.

quotes.race: bet365.com Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Chef De Troupe was entitled to win after his easy win at Southwell last week under a penalty. He was inclined to jump to his right again but actually seemed much better when able to take a lead. He is progressive - Sean Bowen, jockey.

runners.name: Abstract
runners.comment: Has come up with very little off lowly marks since returning from an absence
runners.spotlight: AW winner in 2023 but has come up with very little off lowly marks, all at big prices, since returning from an absence.

runners.name: Forglen
runners.comment: Close up in two of four AW handicaps in 2025; ground to make up on Drouthy Neebor
runners.spotlight: Has finished close up in two of four AW handicaps this year, most recently at 1m6f, but has ground to make up on Drouthy Neebor on recent Chelmsford running and no guarantee of improvement for 2m.

2:30.race_name: British Stallion Studs EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Argentine Tango
runners.comment: Battled well for front-running win at Pontefract and she's respected under a penalty
runners.spotlight: Made a promising start when a close second at Beverley and she built on that with a front-running win at Pontefract (5f, good) 19 days ago; this is tougher under a penalty but she showed a good attitude last time and this well-bred filly is open to more progress.

quotes.race: Racing TV Club Day EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Argentine Tango is as hard as nails and was very hard to break in. But she's tough and she'll improve masses. When the other horse came to her she went again. We might take her to York for the Marygate Stakes - Tim Easterby, trainer.

runners.name: Miss Piggle
runners.comment: Won on Southwell debut and had tough draw in Lily Agnes at Chester latest; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Justified support in good style on her Southwell debut (AW) last month but she weakened into sixth of eight in the Lily Agnes at Chester (good) a week later; bit to prove after that but she was drawn out wide and it wouldn't be a surprise if she bounced back with a big run.

runners.name: Call Margot
runners.comment: Not disgraced in Listed race at the Curragh on debut and should improve for the experience
runners.spotlight: Blue Point filly who cost £40,000 as a yearling; thrown in at the deep end when last of six in a Listed race at the Curragh (good; 100-1) two weeks ago but she wasn't beaten far and should improve for that experience; not ruled out.

runners.name: Fizzy Cristal
runners.comment: Plenty to like on paper and she needs a close look on debut
runners.spotlight: Third foal; Dark Angel half-sister to winners Pink Crystal (5.5f/6f including Listed; RPR 107) and Power Fizz (7f; 95); dam 6f and 7f (Listed) 2yo winner (100), half-sister to useful 7f winner Persuasion; plenty to like on paper and she needs a close look on debut.

runners.name: Soca Star
runners.comment: Well-held third of six on Ripon debut and needs to leave that form a long way behind
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to a useful 6f winner but she was a well-held third of six at Ripon (good) ten days ago and needs to leave that initial form well behind.

runners.name: Theres A Chance
runners.comment: Promising third at Thirsk last month and she sets a fair standard on that form
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to four winners including Flora Of Bermuda (5f/6f including 2yo/Group 3; 116); weak 12-1 shot at Thirsk (good) last month but she was always prominent and kept on well to finish third of ten; that was a promising start and she sets a fair standard on that form.

runners.name: Venetian Sun
runners.comment: 240,000gns yearling; interesting newcomer and she needs a close look in the market
runners.spotlight: 240,000gns yearling; third foal; half-sister to winners Sir Yoshi (Listed-placed 5f 2yo; RPR 96) and Got The Moves (7f; 81); dam Listed-placed 6f/6.5f winner (100); yard has already had plenty of 2yo winners this season and she's an interesting newcomer.

5:00.race_name: pricedup.bet Fillies' Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Mile Series Qualifier)

runners.name: Heavenly Heather
runners.comment: Sprang a massive surprise on AW (1m) on second handicap run; bred to do better yet
runners.spotlight: High-class Godolphin pedigree; fairly low key in early starts, including on turf handicap debut, but she picked up nicely to spring a massive surprise back on AW (1m) in April when miles out of the weights; 2lb higher off new mark but given her breeding she may well improve further.

quotes.race: BetMGM Fillies' And Mares' Championships Handicap
quotes.quote: We always knew Heavenly Heather was a really good horse. It was just getting her fit enough. She's such a big heavy mare she takes that much work getting fit. She's needed the race before and she's been green and backward. She's had loads of graft in the last month. I thought she would be sixth, if you took the first two out it's a basic Class 4 handicap. I knew there was improvement in her - Tracy Waggott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's a big, strong filly. Her dam won twice for Godolphin in 2018 and was rated 91 by the time she finished her career. She hasn't run yet but she'll be out at the back end of the season. 22-08-24

runners.name: Zapphire
runners.comment: Beverley form suggests she'll act well here; cheekpieces an unknown
runners.spotlight: Two turf wins, at 7f (good to soft) and about 1m (good to firm); unraced on this track but her Beverley form suggests she'll appreciate this similarly stiff one; first-time cheekpieces an unknown factor though.

quotes.race: Hull Asphalt Handicap
quotes.quote: Zapphire is not winning out of turn. She's not entirely straightforward but she has a decent level of ability. I popped her in a fillies' handicap in a fortnight at Leopardstown and that might be interesting. She loves soft ground so if it rained over there we'd be even happier - Steve Brown, trainer's husband and assistant.

quotes.race: Betfred 'Passionate About Sport' Handicap
quotes.quote: I'm pleased with that. Zapphire has definitely got ability and she's done that well but she can be a bit of a madam - Julie Camacho, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She belongs to the Elite Racing Club and is a talented filly who can be a little temperamental at times. The handicapper was kind to her after her Haydock win last month as the front two were three lengths clear of the rest. She's in good form and is ready to run again soon, preferably with some cut in the ground. 06-09-23

runners.name: Viennoise
runners.comment: Fair mark on best AW form and hampered latest; more needed on previous turf handicap form
runners.spotlight: This mark should be within reach on AW form and she didn't get the best of runs behind Heavenly Heather on Newcastle AW (first-time cheekpieces, retained) in April but her two turf handicap runs, the latest at Beverley last July for previous yard, leave her with a shade to prove.

runners.name: Flag Of Love
runners.comment: Had 1m form for previous yard; better for recent stable debut; first handicap run
runners.spotlight: Best form by some way when runner-up in 1m Haydock novice on second start; would have needed her reappearance for new yard at Wetherby last month and interesting to see how the market goes now handicapping.

runners.name: Crowns Lady
runners.breeder: Irish National Stud Mare Syndicate III

prev_owners.owner: The Crown Inn Fc Racing Syndicate

runners.comment: Won turf handicap last summer; flourished on AW since; solid chance back on grass
runners.spotlight: Successful handicap debut at Ripon (1m, good to soft) last June; has flourished on AW since and although not entirely convincing on turf since the win, she bumped into one at Beverley (about 1m, good) in April when possibly needing the run for new yard (won this last year); solid claims.

runners.name: Vixey
runners.comment: Appreciated return to turf when cosy winner latest; more to do up in trip and grade
runners.spotlight: Had a good run of form on AW for this yard, winning over 7f at Southwell in March, but she seemed to appreciate the return to turf when coming home with purpose at Beverley (about 7f, good to firm) this month; not dismissed but has more on her plate over this longer trip in a higher grade.

3:30.race_name: PricedUp Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Sprint Series Qualifier)

runners.name: Kings Merchant
runners.comment: Three 6f handicap wins in 2024 but below best this year and now in first-time headgear
runners.spotlight: Three 6f handicap wins in 2024 (all on good to firm), the latest at Thirsk off this mark, but he has to prove suited by a stiff track and fitting blinkers is the response to two below-par runs this year.

quotes.race: Rudding Park Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought Kings Merchant would have been an unlucky loser. He usually does just enough to win and I told Callum not to get to the front too soon, but he's given him a great ride, he was incredibly patient. He travelled all over them and is a really progressive horse. He's only been out of the first three once this year, which is brilliant. He's great fun - Ed Bethell, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Go-Racing-In-Yorkshire Summer Festival Handicap
quotes.quote: King's Merchant is a progressive sprinter. They were two in-form horses behind him and it was a good run. He loves top-of-the-ground, which is why he hadn't run for a month, and six furlongs is his bag - Ed Bethell, trainer.

runners.name: Kats Bob
runners.comment: Won first four starts for this yard but well held latest and now 6lb higher
runners.spotlight: A big success story for this yard, winning his first four 6f starts on AW and turf (good to firm; made all), but he couldn't take advantage of a favourable mark at Pontefract latest and now races off 6lb higher which leaves him with something to find.

stable_tour.quote: He arrived here in February in good nick from Iain Jardine's stable looking for a change of scenery having been in the same yard since he was a yearling. He proceeded to rattle off three on the spin at Newcastle twice and then at Southwell by two lengths. His trip is 6f and he likes some give in theound. I'm looking at Thirsk in May next, but things will be more difficult for him off an all-time high mark. Also entered at Newcastle and Thirsk this week. 09-04-25

runners.name: Jonny Concrete
runners.comment: Progressive at 7f and 6f; up another 3lb for Musselburgh win; may improve further
runners.spotlight: Progressive at 7f and 6f since cheekpieces fitted, beating a good yardstick at Ayr in October (6f, good) and reappearing with another improved show to win at Musselburgh (7f, good) in April; up a further 3lb but may still be ahead of the handicapper.

stable_tour.quote: He's a maiden but has run some massive races. Reflecting on his last couple of races, I think he wants to come back to 7f. He gets a mile but he's got a bit of speed and his best form has been at 7f. He could be progressive on goodish ground. 26-07-24

runners.name: True Promise
runners.comment: Four AW wins at 5f-7f; 0-5 on turf but fair third over 6f at Ripon recently; thereabouts
runners.spotlight: Four AW wins at 5f-7f; 0-5 on turf but he ran well from the front at Ripon (6f, good to firm) ten days ago and he should have the staying power for this stiff test at 6f; can be thereabouts.

stable_tour.quote: He was just a bit immature last year and we had to mind him a little bit. He progressed after winning on his debut at Newcastle in January and followed up under a penalty, but the handicapper hasn't missed him. He's very laid-back and not until we run him will we know if he can keep progressing off that mark, but we're hopeful he can and looking forward to getting him on turf. 04-04-24

runners.name: May Blossom
runners.breeder: J A Knox And Mrs M A Knox
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd & Julie Camacho
runners.comment: Below best since Pontefract win (6f) in August but just 1lb higher; likely type
runners.spotlight: Form retreated at the end of 2024 and she never showed on her Doncaster return but this track will suit better and she's only 1lb higher than when her stamina came into play on the stiff finish at Pontefract (6f, good to firm) in August; potential reviver.

stable_tour.quote: A good filly whio won well at Pontefract and she could go for the Marygate at York on Friday. 10-05-21

She ran a cracker when dropped down to 5f last time at Carlisle and ran on very strongly to finish third behind Angel Shared on what was her third run of the season. She doesn't have any forthcoming entries but I think she'll be winning before too long. 14-06-24

runners.name: Mostar Dreams
runners.owner: J Fyffe, A Edmondson & L Mcgurty
runners.comment: Acts well here, a 7f winner and close second over C&D in 2024; good return for new yard
runners.spotlight: Acts well here, winning over 7f (soft) and going close over C&D (good) for previous yard; not far off her best form when runner-up at Doncaster (6f, good) on her recent stable debut; looks primed for another good run.

stable_tour.quote: I think she's very interesting. She's shown the kind of form she did the other day before and that was quite a good race and she's been showing that kind of ability at home. I'm not sure about trip for her. She's been working well. It's whether we keep her at 6f or go back to five. She's progressive. She possibly needs a bit of cut in the ground. We'll be trying to find similar races for her. She's a nice filly and well-made and good-bodied. I'd imagine there will be improvement in her. Mentally, we were very happy with her. We got her switched off the other day, which probably wasn't an advantage to her. 07-05-25

runners.name: Act Of Violence
runners.breeder: Mrs S Field, Miss S Field & Mr A Turbitt
runners.owner: Peter R Ball, Gentech Ltd & Partners
runners.comment: Impressive at Ripon (6f); weights pull with Jonny Concrete later; might need another run
runners.spotlight: Impressive at Ripon (6f, good) last July; has a weights pull with Jonny Concrete on their Ayr run (6f, good) in the autumn but he dropped out on his Catterick return and it's possible this will be needed, too.

runners.name: Sacred Falls
runners.comment: Last year's winner; won a shade cosily at Catterick latest; major contender
runners.spotlight: Winner of sole C&D start, in this race last year, and she warmed up for a repeat by winning a shade cosily in the end at Catterick (6f, good to firm) last month; major contender.

runners.name: A Girl Named Ivy
runners.comment: Now 2lb lower than 6f win at Pontefract in August; bit to prove on subsequent form
runners.spotlight: Now 2lb lower than her winning mark at Pontefract (6f, good to firm) in August but she flagged in three subsequent runs last year; should come on for her reappearance over 5f but this looks competitive.

stable_tour.quote: She has won twice this season, each time at a big price. She won her maiden at Ayr at 50-1 in May and then won at Pontefract this month at 33-1. She's been a difficult one as she's not big but is very stocky. She wasn't really ready for racing as a two-year-old. She ran once and then we put her away. She won first time out this year and then the ground was maybe a bit quick for her at Thirsk. Then she won at Pontefract but ran badly again back there the other day, finishing last. She's prone to tying up a bit with her muscles and I think this is a problem we've got to work through. Maybe we'll give her a bit more time between her races so that she doesn't tie up. I'll keep her at 6f. 28-08-24

runners.name: Iris Dancer
runners.comment: Latest win over C&D last July; well treated but struggled for a while; blinkers refitted
runners.spotlight: On a decent mark on the pick of her 2024 form when adding two more wins, most recently when narrowly seeing off May Blossom over C&D (good to soft) last July; she's struggled a bit since, thus the favourable mark, but the return to 6f will suit and regular blinkers are refitted.

quotes.race: Usave Business Energy Specialist Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Iris Dancer goes halfway through the race then jacks in a little then she warms back up and you always know you'll get a run out of her in the end. She really enjoys that stiff finish, she gets into top flight just at the line. It'd be nice to find another race before the end of the year and see what we can do - Andrew Mullen, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Usave Business Energy Specialist Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: I think the blinkers just made the difference for Iris Dancer. She's a game horse and always tries her best, and she'll be even better with softer ground - Tristran Davidson, trainer.

3:00.race_name: pricedup.bet Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Sprint Series Qualifier)

runners.name: Water Of Leith
runners.owner: Adam Mills And Jonnie Delta Racing
runners.comment: Recorded his 11th sprint win when scoring at Catterick last week; respected under penalty
runners.spotlight: Recorded his 11th sprint win when landing a Class 5 event at Catterick (6f, good to firm) last Monday; has a 4lb penalty but he remains feasibly treated and is a big player again if this sets up for his closing style.

stable_tour.quote: He won twice for us as a juvenile and then left for a season before joining us in July after a Carlisle win for Rebecca Menzies. He's in the form of his life and has won twice more for us, rising from 61 to 76 in the handicap. He's far from straightforward but we know his quirks. He must walk to the start and goes in the stalls without a jockey. He was carried badly left and promoted to third in the stewards' room at Windsor last Thursday. He stayed down in the area and ran another good race on Saturday when fourth at Ascot, which more than paid for his trip. He thrives on his racing and could be a Bronze Cup hope at Ayr next week. 12-09-22

runners.name: Soul Seeker

prev_owners.owner: C T P, Rasio Cymru & Northern Monkeys

runners.comment: Struggled in both runs for new yard this spring and needs a major revival back in trip
runners.spotlight: Ended last season with a comfortable win at Sandown (5f, good) but he's struggled in two runs for new yard this spring; now only 2lb higher than for his last success but he needs a major revival on this drop back in trip.

quotes.race: Sky Bet "Jump Jockeys' Nunthorpe" Handicap (To Be Ridden By Professional Jump Jockeys)
quotes.quote: It's very different. By the time you get to the winning line here, in a chase you'd just be getting your position, but that was fantastic. I thought Soul Seeker had a good each-way chance because he'd won it before, he looked well handicapped on his old form and David had him spot on. I was on a very experienced, streetwise horse. He's a lovely ride and he did everything for me. The other horse put it up to him and he had to put his head down and battle and he did that. He's very genuine - Micheal Nolan, jockey.

quotes.race: Sky Bet "Jump Jockeys' Nunthorpe" Handicap (To Be Ridden By Professional Jump Jockeys)
quotes.quote: Soul Seeker had soft ground form in Ireland and we thought he wanted 6f, and now he's a 5f horse on fast ground. We learn about these horses as we go along - David O'Meara, trainer.

runners.name: Rock Of England
runners.comment: His last win was in August 2023 and he's been out of sorts in last two runs; down the list
runners.spotlight: Course winner who is well treated on his old form but last win was in August 2023 and he's been out of sorts at Thirsk (6f, good) and Beverley (5f, good to firm) in last two runs; has another change of headgear but he needs a big turnaround.

runners.name: Hurt You Never
runners.comment: 11-time winner and last success was at Hamilton 15 days ago; respected up 5lb
runners.spotlight: 11-time winner and her last success was from the front at Hamilton (5f, good to firm) 15 days ago; that was at odds-on in a small field but she still looks feasibly treated off 5lb higher and could make another bold bid back up in grade.

quotes.race: BetUK. It's Where The UK Bets Handicap
quotes.quote: She's a really game mare. I thought Hurt You Never might need the run but she showed she's in great form. Early on I thought I'd gone a bit quick but she just kept powering through - Mia Nicholls, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: She's been a superstar for us. She hasn't stopped winning and she's honest and tough. The soft ground wasn't ideal for her at Doncaster last week, but she was 4lb well in, so we gave it a go and she ran well to finish fourth behind Jojo Rabbit. She's easy to train and ride. She's won ten times and there'll come a point where the handicapper will have a say, but she'll be winning again. 26-07-24

runners.name: Holbache
runners.breeder: Mayden Stud& Last Day Racing Partnership

prev_owners.owner: Last Day Racing And J & D Dewhurst

runners.comment: Two wins last season but he doesn't have a great record when fresh and this is competitive
runners.spotlight: Versatile ground-wise and he won twice over 5f at Pontefract last year, including in his final run last season; probably still has some room to manoeuvre off this 5lb higher mark but he doesn't have a great record when fresh and this is competitive on his return.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I bagged the rail and Holbache was pretty tough as that ground is hard work. The gelding operation will be the making of him. He's challenging his toughness in the right direction and is on the right track now - Tom Marquand, jockey.

runners.name: Kings Crown
runners.comment: Just 1-27 on turf but he went close at Ayr 18 days ago; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Dual AW winner who is 1-27 on turf but he ran well to finish a close second at Ayr (5f, good to firm) 18 days ago; only 1lb higher here and has claims if he can back that up.

stable_tour.quote: We got him earlier this season from Adrian Nicholls. He was highly tried at two and three and has now dropped to what is a good handicap mark. He started the season on 72 and is down to 62 now. When he puts it together I can't believe he won't be winning soon. He'd be my dark horse. 28-08-24

runners.name: Opal Storm
runners.comment: Generally reliable mare and she didn't get much luck at Beverley last time; dangerous
runners.spotlight: Generally reliable mare who was a close second at Doncaster (5f, good to firm) last month and she didn't get much luck in similar conditions at Beverley last Tuesday; was beaten less than 2l in that race and she's an interesting contender.

quotes.race: Rob Burrow Dare To Dream Handicap
quotes.quote: Opal Storm likes the place but she just needs a bit of luck in running - Brian Rothwell, trainer.

4:30.race_name: PricedUp Daily Sports Boosts Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Twisting Physics
runners.comment: Off the mark at second attempt in 1m AW maiden in November; that form sound; contender
runners.spotlight: Bought for 1,000,000gns as a yearling, though cost 100,000gns when changing hands last May; off the mark at second attempt when winning a 1m novice at Southwell in November (second and third have both won since); down in trip but a contender back on turf.

runners.name: Camino Del Ray
runners.comment: Won 7f AW maiden on debut and decent second in a 7f Redcar maiden latest; should go well
runners.spotlight: Made a winning debut in a 7f maiden at Newcastle in March and sound run on turf debut when runner-up in a Redcar novice last time (7f, good to firm); should go well again.

quotes.race: BetMGM: It's Showtime Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses In Bands C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We thought a fair bit of Camino Del Ray last year but we never ran him - he's a big horse and took him a while to come to hand. Today was an educational day, they've kicked a long way out and my lad just stays all day. He showed plenty of greenness but it all came good towards the end and he'll improve plenty from that - Ryan Sexton, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Comanche Warrior
runners.owner: M & M Racing, Paul Byrne And Partner
runners.comment: 170,000gns yearling; half-brother to three winners; worth a market check on debut
runners.spotlight: 170,000gns yearling; fifth foal; half-brother to three winners; dam German 7f/7.7f winner; worth a market check on debut.

runners.name: Dutch Duke
runners.comment: Not shown a great deal so far and looks more one for handicaps
runners.spotlight: Not shown a great deal so far and looks more one for handicaps.

runners.name: Flame Of Forest
runners.comment: Gelding by Kodiac; over 7l seventh of 12 in a Doncaster novice last month; likely improver
runners.spotlight: Gelding by Kodiac; 33-1 when over 7l seventh of 12 in a Doncaster novice last month (7f, good to firm); likely improver.

runners.name: Highfield Comrade
