runners.comment: By unraced Sogann; third foal; dam 1m4f/1m6f winner; probably best watched on debut
runners.spotlight: By Sogann (unraced); third foal; dam 1m4f/1m6f winner; probably best watched on debut.

runners.name: Legend Forever
runners.comment: Two fair runs over 7f last autumn (blinkered both occasions); no headgear; a possible
runners.spotlight: Two fair runs in novices at Ayr (7f, good) and Redcar (7f, soft) with blinkers last autumn; returns without the headgear but stable going well; a possible.

runners.name: Pal Joey
runners.comment: 2,200gns 3yo; third foal; half-brother to 6f 2yo winner; likely to come on for the run
runners.spotlight: 2,200gns 3yo; third foal; half-brother to 6f 2yo winner; dam Group-placed 6f/7f 2yo winner; newcomer who is likely to come on for the run.

runners.name: Latynina
runners.comment: Newcomer by Expert Eye; half-sister to 7 winners, notably Group 3 scorer; check the market
runners.spotlight: Home-bred filly by Expert Eye; ninth foal; half-sister to seven winners including Group 3 scorer Zonderland; dam placed at 7f/1m; interesting newcomer who is worth a market check.

runners.name: Lovette
runners.comment: First foal of a 7f AW winner; stable's newcomers usually improve for the run.
runners.spotlight: Filly by Oasis Dream; first foal of a 7f AW winner; stable's newcomers usually improve for the run.

runners.name: Precious Sapphire
runners.comment: Twelfth foal; half-sister to six winners; dam 2yo winner; likely to come on for this debut
runners.spotlight: Filly by Belardo; twelfth foal; half-sister to six winners; dam 6f 2yo winner; newcomer who is likely to be better for the experience.

runners.name: Bodygroove
runners.comment: Only Flat win was on AW; hurdles win since; having first Flat run since last May
runners.spotlight: Only Flat win was over this trip on AW in July 2023; won Wetherby h'cap hurdle in March and quite interesting back on the Flat for the first time since last May when seventh of eight at Catterick (2m, good).

runners.name: Trojan Sun
runners.comment: Both wins at Musselburgh, latest last time when making all (1m6f); 2lb higher; chance
runners.spotlight: Both wins have been at Musselburgh, latest when making all earlier this month (1m6f, good); chance off this 2lb higher mark.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Musselburgh over 2m2f in late August and has finished third the last twice- at Chester and Ayr on Tuesday. He's probably going to have another couple of runs this autumn as he seems to handle soft ground. He's a young horse who's improving. He ran on good ground at Ayr on Tuesday and it would be good if we can get another run with him on soft ground before the end of the season. I doubt we'll run him on the all-weather this winter and we'll probably wait until next year with him. 02-10-24

runners.name: Agathon
runners.comment: 0-6; improved with cheekpieces, last time finishing third at Ayr; 1lb lower; interesting
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden; has improved with cheekpieces, best effort when third at Ayr last time (1m5f, good); quite interesting off this 1lb lower mark.

runners.name: Parish Record
runners.comment: 4,000gns buy from Jim Bolger; modest efforts for this yard, 13l behind Trojan Sun latest
runners.spotlight: Ex-Jim Bolger; bought for 4,000 gns in July 2024; modest efforts both starts for this yard, latest when over 13l behind Trojan Sun at Ayr (1m6f, good); bit to find

runners.name: Twoforthegutter
runners.comment: Dual Hamilton winner last June; fair fifth at Ayr last time (behind Agathon); a possible
runners.spotlight: Two wins at Hamilton last June (1m4f, 1m5f, good); back on a good mark and fair run when fifth at Ayr last time (1m5f, good; Agathon third); a possible

runners.name: Team Endeavour
runners.comment: 2m Wetherby winner last June when with Ian Williams; modest form over hurdles for new yard
runners.spotlight: Won a Wetherby handicap last June (2m, good to firm) and was placed on the AW on last two starts when with Ian Williams; not shown much in three runs over hurdles for present yard; needs to bounce back.

runners.name: Billy Bathgate
runners.comment: Two Flat wins, latest in four-runner event over 2m at Newcastle; each-way chance
runners.spotlight: Two Flat wins, over 1m5f at Ayr in June 2023 (1m5f, good to firm) and last time over 2m in a four-runner handicap at Newcastle; still on a fair mark; each-way chance.

runners.name: Bamboo Bay
runners.comment: Three wins on the Flat; not at his best this term but fair run latest; conditions suit
runners.spotlight: Three wins on the Flat, the latest at Redcar last September (1m6f, good to firm); hasn't been at his best this year, although fair run when 10l fourth of 12 at Beverley last time (good to firm).

quotes.race: Edinburgh Gin Classic London Dry Handicap
quotes.quote: Bamboo Bay's draw was a help and the gaps opened and he lengthened from the three-pole. You could step him up in trip and he's probably handicapped well enough - Kevin Stott, jockey

stable_tour.quote: He ran well last week at Beverley when he came second at 25-1 behind Pons Aelius. It was his third race for us and we stepped him up to 2m - his previous two starts came over 1m4f. He's a low-rated horse - he ran off 46 last time - but I was really pleased with him at Beverley and I think he'll now go to Ripon in a couple of weeks. He's at the right end of the handicap to start doing something. 22-08-24

5:30.race_name: PricedUp Daily Sports Boosts Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Mile Series Qualifier)

runners.name: Groundhog
runners.comment: Best run when third on h'cap debut with hood tried; lesser run latest; could bounce back
runners.spotlight: Best run when third at Redcar on handicap debut in a first-time hood in April (1m, good; 7-2 co-favourite) but didn't back that up over same C&D with same headgear on faster ground last time; could bounce back

runners.name: Candle Of Time
runners.comment: Some promise on the AW at 7f/1m in 2024; h'cap debut with hood tried; stiff 1m a worry
runners.spotlight: Some promise in AW maiden/novice company over 7f/1m last season; can pull hard so slight worry about her lasting out over this stiff 1m on her handicap/seasonal/turf debut although hood on for first time.

runners.name: Yesterdays Gone
runners.comment: Some promise in novices (6f); needs to improve on h'cap debut run (7f) on first try at 1m
runners.spotlight: Back on turf having shown promise in novice company over 6f; 5l eighth of 13 when stepped up to 7f on handicap debut at Kempton last time and needs to improve for this further step up in trip; stable in form.

runners.name: Miss Raincloud
runners.comment: Well beaten last two starts over 1m/1m2f last term; more needed on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Fair effort in a course maiden on debut last season (7f, good to soft) but well beaten next two starts (tried over 1m2f last time); needs to improve on handicap debut.

stable_tour.quote: We got her from the Tattersalls October sales last year and she's a half-sister to the Britannia winner Khaloosy. She's had only one run for us, but it was a good one as she finished fifth at Carlisle in July behind Karl Burke's Serving With Style. She's a little bit weak but shows plenty of potential at home. 22-08-24

runners.name: Yellow Dream
runners.comment: Not shown a great deal in three novices; needs to improve for step up to 1m on h'cap debut
runners.spotlight: Not shown a great deal in three 7f novices, latest at Redcar earlier this month when over 15l sixth of eight (7f, good to firm); up in trip on handicap debut; needs to improve.

runners.name: Rose Of New Jersey
runners.comment: Exposed; placed in two nurseries last term but not at her best this year; bit to prove
runners.spotlight: Exposed filly; placed in nurseries at Thirsk (6f, good to soft) and Newcastle last season (7f, standard); not at her best this term (over 1m and 6f); bit to prove at present.

stable_tour.quote: I think she was a bit unlucky on her return at Newcastle at the end of March as she got a little bit squeezed out, so I'm hoping that with a run under her belt she'll be seen to better effect next time. She has entries at Haydock and Doncaster on Saturday. 23-04-25

runners.name: Helaali
runners.comment: Mainly modest efforts; better than last run (met trouble); headgear back on; interesting
runners.spotlight: Third at Kempton with today's headgear combination in February (7f); has since been gelded and given wind surgery; well beaten on first try at 1m at Wetherby on first run back (good to firm; ran without cheekpieces) but met plenty of trouble and is better than the bare form; interesting with cheekpieces back on.

runners.name: Harry Palmer
runners.comment: Third on AW in March; fair run on turf latest (1m, first run after wind op); new headgear
runners.spotlight: Fairly exposed; good third at Newcastle in March (7f, standard) and fair effort when 7l fourth of seven at Redcar last time (1m, good to firm) on first run back after wind surgery; had cheekpieces on for second time that day; blinkers now tried.

runners.name: Due Respect
runners.comment: Ex-John Butler; best efforts at 7f on AW; first run at 1m; stable debut; each-way chance
runners.spotlight: Ex-John Butler; couple of fair efforts at Chelmsford handicaps (7f), latest in April in a race that has worked out quite well; up to 1m on stable debut; each-way chance.

runners.name: Freak Encounter
runners.comment: Ex-Jamie Osborne; AW winner in January (blinkers); 3,000gns buy since; stable debut.
runners.spotlight: Ex-Jamie Osborne; won a 1m Lingfield AW handicap in January when blinkered for first time; some fair efforts since; also third on turf last season (1m, good to firm); bought for 3,000gns last month; makes stable debut with no headgear.

runners.name: Mission In Malton
runners.comment: Improved form with headgear when second at Redcar latest; chance on that form
runners.spotlight: Showed improved form in first time cheekpieces (on again) when second at Redcar last time (1m, good to firm); chance if reproducing that form.

6:20.race_name: British Stallion Studs EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Electrifarhh
runners.comment: Beat a subsequent winner at Kempton in October and she's respected under penalty on return
runners.spotlight: Ran green when last of four on Newbury debut (7f, soft) in September but she found plenty of progress upped to 1m when landing a gamble at Kempton (AW) the following month; has a penalty on her return but that latest form has been boosted by the runner-up since and she's respected back on turf.

stable_tour.quote: She's a lovely filly who I'd been hoping to run in the Fred Darling but she's not come to hand in time. I'm not sure what Planwill be but she has plenty of scope and the form of her Kempton win has been advertised by the runner-up winning since. I think she'll be a miler and it's important she gets some black type for her owner/breeder Yvonne Jacques. 16-04-25

runners.name: Bintazzo
runners.comment: 300,000euros yearling; lots to like on paper and she's an interesting newcomer
runners.spotlight: 300,000euros yearling; half-sister to seven winners including Sudirman (6f 2yo including Group 1; RPR 115), Star of India (7f-10.5f including Australia; 112) and Roman Empire (1m 2yo/HK 1m1f; 111); dam 5f-8.5f winner (including US 8.5f stakes; 103); lots to like on paper and she needs a close look on debut.

runners.name: Blue Bolt
runners.comment: Never involved when 10-11 at Southwell but she's a likely improver on this step up to 1m
runners.spotlight: 400,000euros yearling; never involved when 10-11 favourite at Southwell (7f, Tapeta) last month but that was behind a useful rival and she made some encouraging late headway; should know much more this time and it wouldn't be a surprise if she took a major step forward upped in trip.

runners.name: Chinkara
runners.comment: Sets the standard on her promising run at Ascot and yard was 42% with 3yos here last year
runners.spotlight: Didn't live up to market expectations on Kempton debut in December; reappeared with fifth of six at Ascot (1m, good to firm) last month but was only beaten around 2l in that useful contest and she sets the standard on that promising effort; key player for yard that had a 42% record with 3yos here last year.

runners.name: Satavia
runners.comment: Siyouni filly who has a smart pedigree and needs a close look on debut
runners.spotlight: Third foal; half-sister to 1m4f winner Haskoy (including Group 3; RPR 112); dam 1m2f Listed winner (101), sister to 1m4f winner Ottavio, half-sister to 1m Group 1 winner Spinning Queen, out of unraced half-sister to three high-class 1m-1m2f performers; interesting newcomer and she needs watching in market.

runners.name: Starlit Spice
runners.comment: Two promising runs and latest was at Haydock last month; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on Leicester debut (7f, soft) last September and she reappeared with another eyecatching effort when a close fourth at Haydock (1m, good) last month; has something to find here but it's still early days and she should have more to offer.

5:50.race_name: Juddmonte EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Band D) (EBF Restricted Race Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Ahead Of Fashion
runners.comment: Promising 7th in the Brocklesby; made all at Kempton latest but demoted to 2nd; big chance
runners.spotlight: Promising seventh, beaten under 3l, in the Brocklesby on debut; showed bright speed when making all the running at Kempton two weeks ago but he hung left in the straight and the interference he caused the runner-up was deemed significant enough to reverse the placings; effectively a winner without a penalty and his early pace will be an asset; solid contender.

runners.name: Beyond The Dream
runners.comment: 15,000gns yearling; first foal of a modest maiden; yard 0-48 with 2yos in the last 5 years
runners.spotlight: March foal; 15,000gns yearling; first foal of a modest maiden; stable 0-48 with 2yos in the last five seasons.

runners.name: Coyy
runners.comment: Second run wasn't as promising as his debut (both 5f, good); now tried in a tongue-tie
runners.spotlight: Made a promising debut when fourth at Newbury (5f, good) but he was well below that form at Leicester two weeks later; tongue-tie is now added and has something to prove after that last run.

runners.name: Dapper Charm
runners.breeder: Estate Of The Late Des Vere Hunt
runners.owner: Hambleton Racing Ltd Xxxi And Partner
runners.comment: Runner-up in both starts (5.3f, good to firm) at Brighton; should go well once again
runners.spotlight: Good second on his Brighton debut (5.3f, good to firm) last month; similar form when turned over at long odds-on back at Brighton 19 days ago and the winner did that form no harm with a solid run in Listed company at York last week; should give it another good go.

runners.name: Eyes Front
runners.comment: 12,000gns half-brother to four winners; enough paper appeal to warrant a second look
runners.spotlight: May foal; 12,000gns foal; half-brother to four winners including Inishfallen (Group-placed 6f AW 2yo; RPR 100) and Hurt You Never (prolific 5f/6f; 79); dam French 7.5f-1m1f winner; enough paper appeal to warrant a second look.

runners.name: Gorey Gold
runners.comment: Half-brother to 6f 2yo winner Corinthian Kid (RPR 75); fair standard to aim at on debut
runners.spotlight: April foal; fourth foal; half-brother to 6f 2yo winner Corinthian Kid (RPR 75); dam placed 6f (including 2yo; 72); fair standard to aim at on debut and likely best watched.

runners.name: Jack The Tooth
runners.comment: 18,000gns half-brother to two winners; yard's 2yos yet to get going this season
runners.spotlight: February foal; 5,000gns foal, 18,000gns yearling; ninth foal; half-brother to winners Copinet (5f/6f including 2yo/AW; RPR 90) and Fast Pulchra (Italian 1m-10.6f); dam placed 7f AW in France (71); stable 0-6 (one placed) with 2yos this year.

runners.name: Rising Empire
runners.comment: Promising 4th at Leicester three weeks ago; 6f will suit and he's open to lots of progress
runners.spotlight: Shaped with a great deal of promise when a fast-finishing fourth of 15 at Leicester three weeks ago (5f, good; form looks solid); open to plenty of improvement over the extra furlong and with the benefit of experience.

runners.name: Canyouhearthedrums
runners.comment: Promise behind a useful filly on debut (sent off warm favourite); less good at Ascot since
runners.spotlight: Beaten 6-5 favourite on her Bath debut last month (winner followed up under a penalty); only midfield at Ascot ten days ago; others make more appeal for a stable that also run Coyy.

runners.name: Eclipser
runners.comment: Half-sister to the very useful Pandora's Gift out of well-related 5f winner; check market
runners.spotlight: April foal; 11,000euros yearling; third foal; half-sister to 6f AW winner Pandora's Gift (including 2yo/Listed; RPR 112); dam a well-related 5f winner (90); lots to like on paper.

runners.name: Lady Lauren
runners.comment: 14,000gns yearling; dam a 1m2f winner in France; yard not known for 2yo exploits
runners.spotlight: March foal; 6,000gns foal, 14,000gns yearling; second foal of a 1m2f winner in France, herself from a good family; stable not know for their 2yo exploits.

runners.name: Paroda Diva
runners.owner: Mps Racing Ltd, Roger Thompson & Partner

prev_owners.owner: Mps Racing Ltd, Roger Thompson & Partner

runners.comment: Similar form in two 5f runs so far; marked improvement needed to take this
runners.spotlight: She has run to a similar level in two 5f runs (good to firm and Polytrack) so far; marked improvement needed to score.

6:50.race_name: Fitzdares Sprint Series Handicap (Fitzdares Windsor Sprint Series Qualifier)

runners.name: Twilight Jet

prev_owners.owner: Michael Iavarone & Julia Iavarone & Michael O'Callaghan

runners.comment: Two Group 3 wins for M O'Callaghan; makes stable debut off a reduced mark; check betting
runners.spotlight: Won the Group 3 Cornwallis Stakes as a 2yo; regularly ran well in the face of stiff tasks last season and he starts out for his new stable off an 8lb lower mark than when last tackling a handicap; worth a market check.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Abergwaun Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: It's a very sharp five at Tipperary, hence the headgear, but it kept Twilight Jet concentrated. We'd lots of dreams and aspirations after he won the Lacken but  he was very sick after Ascot, then had colic surgery since and later slipped on a hard surface so needed surgery on his hock. This year was race to race so and he had a good blow afterwards. The headgear may stay on. He could go to Newbury or further afield in the coming months and may stay in training - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer.

quotes.race: Goffs Lacken Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Twilight Jet doesn't know when to stop. He's a very good horse. He's as tough. He got better and quicker with every run. He went to the Breeders Cup and that might have been one race too many for him. He's come back bigger and stronger this year and even quicker I think. He's the real deal - Leigh Roche, jockey.

quotes.race: Newmarket Academy Godolphin Beacon Project Cornwallis Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: The plan was to make the running but we got a nice lead into it and the race couldn't have gone any better. Twilight Jet has plenty of speed and handled the drop back to five. He liked this ground but is quite versatile in that regard - Leigh Roche, rider.

runners.name: Toca Madera
runners.comment: 2 good runs this year, including 3rd of 17 at York last week; solid claims in weaker race
runners.spotlight: 6f win here last summer (good to firm) off 1lb lower; two good runs this season sandwich a lesser effort at Goodwood, the latest when third of 17 at York last week (5f, good to firm); off the bridle some way out but stuck on well on that occasion and this isn't so demanding; serious contender.

quotes.race: British EBF 40th Anniversary Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Bands B, C And D) (Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: Toca Madera had done everything right first time, and was a little bit unlucky, but he did that well. We'll see how he comes out of it. He didn't like the ground but Kieran was very complimentary, saying he'll be better on much better ground. With rain round the corner Royal Ascot is a possibility - Brian Meehan, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Woolhampton
runners.comment: C&D win last summer; will come good again at some point but it's been a slow start to 2025
runners.spotlight: Yet to shine in two runs this year; won over C&D on fast ground last summer but she may need a bit more help from the handicapper before she's of major interest.

stable_tour.quote: She seems to be an Ascot specialist- she loves the place and goes there again for the big £100,000 handicap this week. After that, all being well, she'll go- like Amazonian Dream- for the sprint final at Windsor on August 12. She's done very well over 5f (and won a qualifier over 5f at Windsor), but for £75,000 we'll have a crack over 6f. 11-07-24

runners.name: Paddys Day
runners.comment: Four AW wins this year; also ran well back on turf latest; no room for error off this mark
runners.spotlight: Course winner; had a purple patch on AW this year, winning four 5f handicaps on the bounce, and he also ran well back on turf when third at Musselburgh seven weeks ago; not much room for error off this mark though.

stable_tour.quote: A winner at Windsor on his debut, he's come out of that race really well and is an uncomplicated horse who should be suited by six furlongs at Ascot. It won't be easy but he's always gone very well and takes everything in his stride. 09-06-22

runners.name: Rhythm N Hooves
runners.comment: String of good runs, AW and turf, in 2025; each-way claims once more
runners.spotlight: He's been in good form since returning to action in December, winning twice at Southwell and running well in defeat the last twice (turf latest); Rossa Ryan booked and each-way claims again.

quotes.race: Palace of Holyroodhouse Stakes (Handicap)
quotes.quote: Rhythm N Hooves was inexperienced coming into this, it was only his fifth race. He learnt a lot at York the last day, that was a big shock for him going from all-weather novices through to these 20, 25-runner handicaps. He has obviously shown a high level of ability here, so hopefully we can either go to more of these high-grade handicaps, but I wouldn't put it past going for a Listed race maybe with him at some point - Archie Watson, trainer.

runners.name: Regal Envoy
runners.comment: Ended 2024 in good form & running well this year too; close 2nd (6f) last week; contender
runners.spotlight: Ended 2024 in good form and he's carried on the good work this year, beating Toca Madera at Newmarket last month and then going down narrowly over 6f here last week; good chance off the same mark with Oisin Murphy retaining the ride.

quotes.race: Aston Martin Handicap
quotes.quote: Regal Envoy enjoyed the fast pace and the track and trip suited him. He likes five furlongs or six around a bend but I don't know where we are going next - William Knight, trainer.

runners.name: Ziggys Missile
runners.comment: Chasing a hat-trick and latest AW win represented another career best; stable run two here
runners.spotlight: Gained his first turf success when scoring at Nottingham (5f, good) last month and followed up at Southwell three weeks ago, producing a career-best effort in the process; 3lb rise not excessive and although this is a step up in class, he can't be discounted in his current form; stable also run Rhythm N Hooves.

runners.name: Jumbeau
runners.comment: Won this race last year off 1lb lower; three solid efforts this year; each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Not the easiest to win with but she did take the corresponding race 12 months ago (good ground; cheekpieces first time; only five ran); three solid efforts in defeat this year and holds each-way claims again.

stable_tour.quote: She's a lovely mare who's really consistent and tries hard. She ran great on her seasonal debut at Epsom recently and will now go to Windsor for the race she won last year. She's really likeable and hopefully she can win another race or two this year. She doesn't get dropped much by the handicapper because she always runs so well. 14-05-25

runners.name: Existent
runners.comment: In good form and on a handy mark; sure to run well but not easy to win with
runners.spotlight: On a long losing run but he retains a good deal of ability and has run a string of good races in defeat this year, most recently when second of seven at Goodwood 17 days ago (5f, good; solid form); possibly hit the front too soon there and a 1lb rise is no issue but he usually manages to find a way of getting beaten.

quotes.race: Betfair Palace House Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Existent is a nice straightforward horse to deal with and hopefully he will now go on to the King's Stand Stakes. Tom (Morley, owner) and his mum have won the race twice before and we entered him for it last week. It is a bit of an ask, being rated 101, but we think he definitely warranted an entry and I think it should suit him. I think five is his best trip for us - Stuart Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: Prestige Agri Maiden Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: The race didn't go right at Ascot and Existent didn't come out of the race the way we would have liked. He's a strong horse now and as long as he's in good order then we'll look to go to the Horris Hill with him - John Gosden, trainer.

runners.name: Macari
runners.owner: R Vaughan, R Bisiker, M Jones And S West

prev_owners.owner: Ricki Vaughan, R Bisiker, Sheena West
Ricky Vaughan, R Bisiker, Sheena West

runners.comment: Won at Salisbury on Thursday and he's respected under a penalty on this drop back in trip
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner who recorded his second Flat win when scoring under a positive ride at Salisbury (1m6f, good to firm) on Thursday; has a penalty in this deeper race but he was as good as ever last time and this drop back in trip should be fine; respected.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld, Dubai "City Bowl" Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: Macari is still quick enough for a mile and a half but he's always going to stay as a two-and-a-half-mile hurdler. He can go with whatever is available. If there's nothing over jumps he can do it on the Flat. He's versatile and not ground dependent. It makes such a difference having a horse who can do what you want him to - Sheena West, trainer.

runners.name: Xiomara
runners.comment: Record of 1-12 and made low-key start for new yard here last month; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Won soft-ground maiden in France for David Menuisier last August and placed in Doncaster handicap (1m4f, good to soft) the following month; had tough assignments in Listed events in next two starts but she returned to calmer waters with ninth of ten on stable debut here (1m2f, good to firm) last month; may have needed that run but she's now 1-12 and others are more convincing.

stable_tour.quote: She's well-bred and ran at Lingfield last Thursday. Sadly her draw in stall 11 of 12 didn't make her life easy, but she ran well to be fifth. She'll get a handicap mark now and improve when she goes up in trip. She was hot in the head last year, like a lot of Lope De Vega progeny, but will get better with experience. I'm hoping she can pick up some black type. 11-04-24

runners.name: First Officer

prev_owners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith

runners.comment: Course winner who ran well here on his return last month; in the mix back up in trip
runners.spotlight: Won here (1m2f, good to soft) last April and was also successful at Newmarket (1m1f, soft) in the autumn; only 1lb higher than for that last success and he reappeared with a creditable fourth back at this track last month; should benefit from that run and he has won over 1m4f on fast ground in the past; in the mix.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld, Dubai Handicap
quotes.quote: The plan would be come back for the Challenge Whip here in November which First Officer won last year - Jane Chapple Hyam, trainer.

quotes.race: Newmarket Challenge Whip Handicap
quotes.quote: I wasn't going anywhere when the leader quickened a couple of furlongs out but First Officer stayed on the best up the hill - David Egan, rider.

quotes.race: Every Race Live On Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: Jane has improved First Officer a hell of a lot and she thought he would run a big race judging by his work. The drop in trip suited and the ground was no issue to him. He tries very hard - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: Showcasing Standing At Whitsbury Manor Bibury Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: First Officer was well on top at the end, but the ground was probably a bit quick for him. The step up in trip helped him, but I don't think we need to go further and I wouldn't think this is the end of him; he'll be better as he gets older - Andrea Atzeni, rider.

runners.name: Cavalry Call
runners.comment: Comfortable win at Chelmsford and he looks worth a try at this new trip; interesting
runners.spotlight: Went close at Chelmsford (1m2f, AW) and Bath (1m2f, good to firm) last month before a comfortable success back at Chelmsford (first-time visor) last time; 3lb higher at this new trip but he was strong at the finish last time and he still has scope for further progress; interesting contender.

runners.name: Educator

prev_owners.owner: HM The King & HM The Queen

runners.comment: Ended long losing run when scoring after wind surgery at Lingfield; respected back on turf
runners.spotlight: Ended a three-year losing spell when scoring off a reduced mark at Lingfield (1m4f, AW) last month, on his first run after wind surgery; back up 4lb in the weights but that was a smooth success and he could be a big factor again back on turf.

quotes.race: Download The Racecourse App Raceday Ready Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: They bought Educator as a three-year-old off William Haggas. He ran well for Mick Appleby, but he was running over a mile-six and two miles, and I always thought he seemed to have a bit more speed - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Radcliffe & Co Handicap
quotes.quote: We've always thought of Educator as a pretty decent horse and still think at home there are great signs of him being a pretty decent animal, he just needs racing now. He'll strip much fitter next time and be more focused. When he won, we thought he should have won further - we thought we were ahead of the handicapper, but he only does enough. William had him in the Derby early on and we felt he was a stakes-level horse - John Warren, royal racing adviser.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: It's great to win with a homebred such as Educator in these colours. He's in everything but it could well be that he needs a mile and a half - William Haggas, trainer.

quotes.race: Mike James Occasionals Memorial EBF Novice Stakes (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Educator is well-bred and had experience over the rest of the field. He wore cheekpieces for the first time just to help him travel a little bit better into the race. It took him a while to get going, but as soon as I asked him, he picked up well and hit the line very strongly. He gave me a proper feel, he's a really nice horse with a good temperament. He's improving with each run and is going to get better with racing. He's got a big frame to fill as well and is going to be exciting for next year - Cieren Fallon, jockey.

runners.name: Fast Steps
runners.comment: Generally reliable type who is on a workable mark and is effective at 1m4f; possibilities
runners.spotlight: All four wins have been at shorter trips but he has form at 1m4f and is generally reliable; wasn't beaten far here on his reappearance three weeks ago and he's now only 1lb higher than for his Newbury win (1m2f, good to firm) last summer; dangerous back up in trip.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Handicap
quotes.quote: Fast Steps was an expensive horse as a yearling and we bought him out of Richard Hannon's yard where he'd been a pacemaker. He was a bit sour and my son Patrick rides him well. We've got to keep his brain in gear, but he has got ability and the ground wasn't that important - he'd go on better ground - Rod Millman, trainer.

quotes.race: Spring Meeting Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: I was a little worried about the track beforehand and so was Ryan because the horse got a bit unbalanced straightening up at Lingfield. Fast Steps learned from that and went around here without a problem. I don't think he's a world beater at the moment but he's improving and it's early days - Philip Robinson, racing manager.

stable_tour.quote: He was a very expensive yearling of Richard Hannon's and we bought him. He'd been a good workhorse at home and I think he had got used to being overtaken. As soon as he got headed in a race he'd give up, so we tried to ride him differently. He's a good-looking horse who's won a few races for us now and has got a lot of ability. He won last Thursday at Newbury under Oisin Murphy. 11-07-24

runners.name: Crystal Mariner
runners.comment: Sole win was two years ago but he chased home Cavalry Call on AW latest; each-way claims
runners.spotlight: His sole win was in a Tapeta maiden (1m2f) two years ago but he's well treated on his best form and was a creditable second behind Cavalry Call at Chelmsford (1m2f; tongue-tie added) last month; this step back up in trip should be fine and he could go well again back on turf.

runners.name: Odin Legacy
runners.comment: Made all off 3lb lower at Salisbury but this is tougher back up in trip/grade
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the ninth attempt when making virtually all off 3lb lower at Salisbury (1m2f, good to firm) 15 days ago; battled well in that race but that was a narrow success in a small field and this is tougher back up in trip and grade.

runners.name: Carnival Day
runners.comment: Two respectable efforts behind emphatic winners this season but others are more persuasive
runners.spotlight: 1m2f winner at Brighton (soft) and Sandown (good) last September; two respectable efforts behind emphatic winners over 1m4f this season but he's still 3lb higher than for his last success and this is highly competitive; others preferred.

runners.name: Dayzee
runners.comment: On reduced mark but she needs to raise her game at this new trip
runners.spotlight: Won three of her first five starts but last success was in June 2023 and she's finished down the field in her last five runs; mark continues to fall but she needs to raise her game at this new trip.

quotes.race: Floodlit Fridays At Dundalk Fillies' Maiden
quotes.quote: Dayzee has always showed us plenty at home. Jack just let her get into a rhythm and he said she was still a bit green. She will go a bit further - Mark Fahey, trainer.

runners.name: Kingkeer
runners.comment: Unexposed 4yo who won over C&D two weeks ago and is open to more progress; big player
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who returned after a gelding operation with a fast-ground win over C&D (6-5 favourite) two weeks ago; this is tougher off 4lb higher but he showed a good attitude for that convincing success and is open to more progress; big player.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice horse who's had just two runs. He ran pretty well first time out at Windsor and then finished last of nine at Salisbury, but the ground there was too soft - we can put a line through that one. He needs decent ground and should do better when he gets it. 06-06-24

runners.name: Ice Opera
runners.comment: 0-13 and was beaten 9l behind Kingkeer over C&D two weeks ago; passed over
runners.spotlight: 13-race maiden who has been well held in his last four runs including a 9l defeat behind Kingkeer over C&D two weeks ago; passed over.

8:20.race_name: Play At The Races Stableduel Handicap

runners.name: Fighting Poet
runners.comment: Two Brighton wins (1m4f and 1m2f) in 2024; never sighted there on return; other days
runners.spotlight: Kept to downhill tracks on turf in 2024, winning twice at Brighton (1m4f and 1m2f; good to firm and good); never sighted on his recent reappearance there and likely to be other days.

quotes.race: Vickers.Bet For Best Prices Guaranteed Handicap
quotes.quote: Fighting Poet doesn't wear blinkers for fashion purposes and things had to go right, but he's got the talent to run well. After his last run, he seems to be improving a little bit recently and we've changed his training regime a little bit. Leah [Brundle], who looks after him, has done a great job. They're a great couple and I'm delighted for them. I'm also delighted for the Adlestrop Club. They are wonderfully enthusiastic people and we've had some fun over the years and it's nice to finally get his head in front for them - Trainer Richard Phillips, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Offiahs Boy
runners.comment: Fulfilled earlier AW promise when giving best only late on at Leicester (1m2f); same mark
runners.spotlight: Downbeat over hurdles for this yard but he confirmed earlier AW handicap promise when only just giving best at Leicester (1m2f, good to firm) nine days ago; left on the same mark and should go well again.

runners.name: Charles Morin

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late K Abdullah

runners.comment: Returns from fruitless hurdling spell but capable of good run if that hasn't left a mark
runners.spotlight: Comes into it on Lingfield turf win (1m1f, good) last May and he subsequently ran well over C&D; very capable of going well if a fruitless spell over hurdles hasn't taken the edge off him; cheekpieces refitted.

runners.name: Crowd Quake
runners.comment: Appreciated the switch to turf and new trip when C&D winner latest; up 6lb; can improve
runners.spotlight: Modest qualifying form over 5f but bred to do better, being out of triple Group winner at up to about 1m1f; no great shakes on AW handicap debut but he appreciated the switch to turf and new trip when winning over C&D latest; up 6lb but still on a low mark; strong chance.

runners.name: The Pug
runners.comment: Three AW wins at 1m2f/1m3f in 2023; rather up and down over the winter; yard in form
runners.spotlight: Three AW wins at 1m2f and 1m3f in 2023 and not entirely to blame for his handful of turf defeats; he's been rather up and down over the winter though and while his yard is in fine form he can't make strong appeal.

runners.name: Formal Address
runners.comment: Promising handicap debut on AW (1m2f); not so good since; fitting tongue-tie could help
runners.spotlight: Promising handicap debut at Lingfield (1m2f, AW) when a hampered close third but he failed to find much over the trip at Brighton before failing to stay the extended 1m3f at Bath last month; still has potential if fitting a tongue-tie helps.

runners.name: Sunset In Paris
runners.comment: Five AW wins at about 1m2f but needs to improve on handful of turf starts to have a chance
runners.spotlight: Five AW wins at about 1m2f, most recently in August, but he didn't run well at Southwell last month and needs to improve on his handful of turf starts (0-7) to have any chance.

runners.name: Glen Esk
runners.comment: Two C&D wins before absence; it's proving a long road back for this yard; up against it
runners.spotlight: Two of four wins came over C&D but he missed all of 2023 and it's proving a long road back for this yard; up against it.

quotes.race: Giants Hall Handicap
quotes.quote: Glen Esk is a big unit and he's strengthened up a bit from last year. As he's a big horse I thought he might need the race and hopefully we can build on that through the year. There might be a nice little race to win with him further down the line - winning trainer Chris Wall.

stable_tour.quote: He was slow to come to hand this spring but we finally got him out at Yarmouth early this month when he ran a cracker to finish a neck second over a mile. We took him to Windsor on Sunday over 1m2f as he's a more mature horse this year and I thought he was properly ready for the trip, and he won well by three and a quarter lengths off a mark of 63. 30-06-21

runners.name: Devizes
runners.breeder: Sir P Vela, Triermore Stud & New England
runners.comment: Multiple AW winner at 1m4f-2m but out of sorts over the winter; 0-6 on turf
runners.spotlight: Multiple AW winner at 1m4f-2m but he was out of sorts over the winter and this is a rare turf run for him (0-6); others more likely.

runners.name: Pop Noodle
runners.comment: Much lower in weights than 1m2f turf handicap runs in 2024 but continues vulnerable
runners.spotlight: Much lower in the weights than when running in 1m2f turf handicaps last summer but he's been vulnerable in ordinary AW events this year and he's down the list this time.

runners.name: Regal Glory
runners.comment: Sole win at 7f; found little in first 1m2f run on AW latest; remains with plenty to prove
runners.spotlight: Sole win at 7f and she didn't find much when upped to this trip on Lingfield AW last month; remains with plenty to prove at 1m2f.

runners.name: Run Joy Run
runners.comment: AW winner at 1m in early 2024; modest AW and hurdle form for new yard; best watched
runners.spotlight: AW winner at 1m for previous yard but she's finished out the back in AW classified races for new connections before pulling up on hurdle debut last week; best watched for now.

5:20.race_name: Weekend Winners On At The Races Handicap

runners.name: Diamond Dreamer
runners.comment: Better strike-rate on AW than turf; fair 4th 2 weeks ago but others perhaps better treated
runners.spotlight: 5-17 on AW as opposed to 1-8 on turf but he has form on fast ground and wasn't beaten far back on turf at Goodwood 16 days ago; others perhaps better treated here though.

runners.name: Faustus
runners.comment: Two 5f wins last summer; on winning mark; should fare better having had a run last month
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who won twice over 5f last summer; showed pace but dropped away to finish tenth of 11 on his Epsom reappearance four weeks ago; better expected here but unlikely to get an easy time of things up front.

runners.name: Nogos Dream
runners.comment: Not easy to win with but reliable, in-form and goes well at the track; contender
runners.spotlight: Modest strike-rate but he's a reliable sprinter and he did manage to win a competitive Chelmsford event on Good Friday (5f); solid third at Goodwood 16 days ago (finished in front of Diamond Dreamer) and he's yet to run a poor race at this track; should be involved.

stable_tour.quote: Some people don't like him but I love him. If every horse in the yard was second nearly every time they ran you'd be happy. He's a bit quirky and we took all the gear off him for Sandown on Saturday, when he finished fourth after getting no luck in running. But that's Nogo, you have to ride him for luck and we didn't get it. He's ultra-consistent and it's just about finding the key to him. 18-09-24

runners.name: Lipsink
runners.comment: Absent since a poor run in December but can go well fresh; other pace to deal with
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer; successful at Wolverhampton in November (5f) but ran poorly at December; can go well fresh but likely to face competition for the lead; seems to handle any ground.

quotes.race: Discover Whats Trending At Rhino.Bet Casino Handicap
quotes.quote: That was a bit of a surprise. We thought Lipsink needed that badly today which he probably did so he's going to come on a lot. He's a nice horse. He's in here again next week and we'll probably bring him back - Mick Appleby, trainer.

runners.name: The Coffee Pod
runners.comment: Dangerous mark on his best form but he's looked temperamental in two runs this year
runners.spotlight: Capable of useful form on his day and he won at York last summer off a 3lb higher mark; gelded over the winter but it hasn't helped his temperament judged on his two racecourse appearances this year; no surprise to see him fare better in what should be a well run race but there are risks attached for now.

quotes.race: Ire Incentive, It Pays To Buy Irish EBF Novice Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: The Coffee Pod was third in the Hornblower last time to a couple of good horses, but we thought this would suit him. Richard says he wants 7f, maybe a mile eventually, so we might step him up next time. We've got the job done and hopefully go on from there - Tim Palin, racing director of Middleham Park Racing, owners.

runners.name: Caffu Zafeen
runners.owner: Jastar Ltd, Murt Khan & Harry Wigan
runners.comment: Hopes are pinned on a wind op/drop in trip prompting something extra from him
runners.spotlight: Hasn't looked ahead of the handicapper for this yard, finishing sixth in three AW runs over the winter; he has undergone wind surgery since the latest of them and hopes rest on that, allied to the drop to 5f, prompting something extra from him.

runners.name: Maharajas Express
runners.comment: Several excuses at Lingfield (5f, good to firm) 9 days ago; in good form on AW beforehand
runners.spotlight: In good form on AW this year, including when fourth to Nogo's Dream at Chelmsford on Good Friday when poorly drawn; sent off co-favourite for his return to turf at Lingfield nine days ago but had a poor draw, got stuck out in the middle of the track and was hampered as well so that run is not the one to judge him on; high on the list.

quotes.race: BetUK It's Where The UK Bets Handicap
quotes.quote: I knew they were going to go pretty hard but I was able to sit a little bit further forward than I did last time. Maharajas Express is quite a keen horse but he relaxed nice enough halfway and it took a while to really hit top gear today. I got a bit of luck up the straight but he's very tough and there's more improvement in him - David Probert, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

7:50.race_name: Follow Fitzdares On Instagram & X Handicap

runners.name: Epimeteo
runners.comment: Still lightly raced but he needs improvement with headgear added at this new trip
runners.spotlight: Landed the odds in a Chelmsford novice (1m2f, AW) in December but he's finished a well-held sixth in two handicaps this spring; still lightly raced but he needs improvement with headgear added at this new trip.

runners.name: Riyadh Gem
runners.comment: 2-2 in handicaps and he's open to more progress on his step up to this trip; respected
runners.spotlight: Well held in three novice events but he won at 22-1 on handicap debut at Southwell (1m) in November and followed up over 9.4f at Wolverhampton on his recent return; up another 3lb but he's on a roll and is open to more progress on his step up to this trip; respected on turf debut.

runners.name: Dalmally
runners.comment: Still unexposed after only five starts and he's one to keep an eye on at this new trip
runners.spotlight: Won a Brighton maiden (1m, good to soft) in his final 2yo run and he started his handicap career with a respectable effort at Chelmsford (1m2f, first run since gelded) last month; now takes another step up in trip but he has plenty of stamina on dam's side and is still unexposed after only five starts; one to keep an eye on.

runners.name: Plymouth Brethren
runners.comment: Pulled hard in last two runs and needs to settle better on this handicap debut; hood added
runners.spotlight: Shaped with promise on his Wolverhampton debut (8.6f) in March but he's struggled after pulling hard in his last two starts (1m2f); still early days and hood is now added on handicap debut but he needs to settle much better to make an impact.

runners.name: Schemaya
runners.comment: Eyecatching third here (1m2f) latest and she's an interesting contender on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Unexposed filly who got closer to the target when 3l third in a maiden here (1m2f, good to firm) three weeks ago; that was eyecatching from off the pace and she's an interesting contender back over this longer trip on handicap debut.

runners.name: Northwest Passage
runners.comment: 0-8 but he didn't get any luck when second at Goodwood latest; big player back up in trip
runners.spotlight: 0-8 but he's finished runner-up in his last two starts and he didn't get any luck at Goodwood (1m2f, good) 17 days ago; up another 3lb but he still has potential and is a big player back up in trip.

runners.name: Kingmaker
runners.comment: Unexposed but was behind Northwest Passage latest and needs to find more at this new trip
runners.spotlight: Finished down the field in all four runs including when 2-1 favourite on recent handicap debut at Goodwood (1m2f, good); still early days but he finished behind Northwest Passage last time and he needs to find more at this new trip.
